00140147.about: Structural Design is introduced as a complex problem-solving process by which resources are to be converted into Structural Systems. The Structural Systems are discussed and explained from point of view of their stress structural behaviour. The applications of the above principles are illustrated by assignments leading to the design of large halls, high-rise structures, hanging roofs, shells,domes, etc. Group discussions are held in order to compare the proposed design solutions based on criteria such as structural performance, construction, economy, erection, form, etc.
00140147.name: Conceptual Structural Design 1

00140148.about: Principles of design. Structural components and structural systems. Systems built of linear and planar components. Analysis of the load transfer system. Investigation of alternatives for the solution of complex structures. The interaction between shape and load resistance. Problems of overall stability. Investigation of existing structures.
00140148.name: Principles of Structural Design

00140149.about: Design of columns (slenderness). Torsion. Punching. Tow way slabs (the differential equation and particular solutions). Line loads.Total moment. Continuous two way slabs. Plastic methods (Yield line theory and strip method). Flat slabs. Ribbed and waffle slabs.
00140149.name: Concrete Structures 2

00140150.about: Properties of structural steels, analysis of members:  tension, compression, trusses, bending, beam-columns, principles of the design and analysis of connections, (welding, bolts, ordinary and high strength) stability of steel structures.
00140150.name: Steel Structures 1

00140151.about: Pre-requisite: cumulative average of 86 or above with at least 100 credit points at the subscription date. Any student eligible to register will be supervised by one of the faculty members on a subject that the latter has agreed to instruct. The student will haveto submit a final report. Registration for the course is conditional on a faculty member agreeing to supervise the student.
00140151.name: Struct Eng Topic for Excellent Students

00140153.about: Review of concrete and reinforcing steel properties. Limit state analysis. Service limit state: Introduction to calculation of deflection: cracking moment, review of methods (equivalent moment of interia, equivalent curvature). Ultimate limit design of cross-sections under bebding moment without. with axial force. One way solid slabs. Curtailment of longitudinal reinforcement. Bond and anchorage. Shear in reinforced concrete beams. Redistribution of moments.
00140153.name: Concrete Structures 1

00140201.about: The course is intended to promote a practical and innovative engineering approach, encouraging students, as future engineers, to assume full responsibility and commitment to implement their suggestions and plans. The students activities are guided and supervised through the following steps: defining the project, collecting and evaluating the necessary data, formulating and comparing various alternative engineering solutions. The project should be presented in an organised, detailed and convincing report, explaining goals and findings and analyzing the advantages and disadvantages of the proposed solutions. The report should include as well recommendati ons for further activities. Two students can cooperate and share the work on one project.
00140201.name: Water Engineering Project 1

00140202.about: the course objective is to train the student in detailed design of an engineering water project. the student will extend the general solution selected in the course of water engineering project 1 to a detailed design, or alternatively choose, after consultation with the course teacher, other components of a water engineering project. the student is required to prepare a detailed report for implementation, including cross sections and layout of elements, figures, etc.
00140202.name: Water Engineering Project 2

00140205.about: Dimensional analysis, similitude and models. Flow in open channels: steady and uniform flow, design of open channels, specific energy, transitions, hydraulic pump, gradually varied flow and backwater curves. Principles of turbulent flows, flows in closed conduits, pumps, systems of closed conduits and pumps.
00140205.name: Hydraulics

00140211.about: HYDROSTATICS, CONTROL VOLUME AND THE INTEGRAL FORM OF CONSERVATION LAWS (MASS, LINEAR MOMENTUM, AND ENERGY), BERNOULLI EQUATION, DIFFERENTIAL FORM OF THE CONSERVATION LAWS (CONTINUITY AND NAVIERSTOKES EQUATIONS), BOUNDARY CONDITIONS, PARTICULAR SOLUTIONS OF THE NAVIER-STOKES EQUATIONS: POTENTIAL FLOW.
00140211.name: Fluid Mechanics

00140213.about: introduction, dimensional analysis, flow in pipes, pumping stations, networks, flow in canals, the hydrological cycle, watersheds, use of statistics in hydrology, precipitation, infiltration, hydrographs, aquifers, darcy's law.
00140213.name: Introduction to Hydraulics and Hydrology

00140214.about: hydrostatics. integral formulation of fluid flow, control volume, continuity equation, momentum equation in integral form. differential formulation of fluid flow, flow kinematics, continuity equation, acceleration, stress - rate of strain relation. newtonian fluid. differential momentum equation. navier-stokes equations, boundary conditions, exact solutions: couette and poiseuille flows. bernoulli equation, energy equation, flow measurement, flow in pipes, laminar and turbulent, friction losses, pipe systems, potential flow, basic solutions, boundary layers.
00140214.name: Fundamental Fluid Mechanics

00140300.about: Presentation of a technical and scientific subject in environmental engineering. The student is required to select a relevant topicfrom a list of suggested subjects,  define the subject, collect and analyze relevant literature and information. The student is required to give an oral presentation and submit a written report. All students are expected to participate in the discussion of the seminar subjects and in the oral presentation.
00140300.name: Meminar in Environmental Engineering

00140301.about: Planning of a project in environmental engineering. Self study of an engineering problem. General plannig and comparison of different solutions. Design of one alternative including a technical report and relevant drawings.
00140301.name: Project in Environmental Engineering

00140305.about: Laboratory exercises include determination of physical, chemical and microbiological quality of water and waste-water: turbidity, various types of solids color, pH,  alkalinity, carbonate equilibrium: quantitive determination of pollution by bacterial and viral indicators. Selected experiments on water and wastewater treatment processes: settling, filtration, flocculation  disinfection and biological treatment.
00140305.name: Lab. of Water and Wastewater Treatment

00140309.about: Water quality as a factor in the national economy.  Systems and processes for water and wastewater treatment:  aeration, flocculation, settling, granular media filtration, adsorption, advanced biological processes for wastewater treatment and reuse, tertiary treatment. Overall design considerations of treatment systems.
00140309.name: Water and wastewater technologies

00140313.about: Brief description of prokorytes and eukorytes differences. Bacterial species in water and soil. Viruses (human) and water. Parasitic protozoa in drinking water. Means of removal of bacteria, viruses and protozoa in water. Bacterial regrowth in water supply systems. N,C,S,P elements cycles connected to bacteria and geomicrobiological aspects. Health risk assessment of contaminated water. Introduction to epidemilogy. Basic methods of study. Experimental and case-control studies making sense out of study. Experimental and case-control studies. Making sense out of statictical associations.
00140313.name: Environmental Microbi. and Epidemiology

00140316.about: fields of interest in environmental engineering. basic data for environmental projects. water quality and standards. basic principles of water treatment: sedimentation, filtration, flocculation, softening. wastewater treatment: sedimentation, biological treatment. sludge treatment. principles of air quality. solid waste.
00140316.name: Int. to Environmental Engineering

00140319.about: Safety instructions and introduction to analytical lab, basic water characterization, potentiometric titrations, alkalinity. acidity determination in complex systems and acid.base calculations, colorimetry, solids precipitation and softening, organic matter and electron donating potential determination (COD.BOD), chlorination, detergents extraction and analysis, sample preparation and ic, gc and toc demonstration, redox processes.
00140319.name: Laboratory in Aquatic Chemistry

00140320.about: Solutions: weak acid.base equilibria. Effect of ionic strengh and temperature on equilibrium constants. The carbobnate system. Buffer intensity. Development of equations for the various forms of alkalinity and acidity. Solving of acid-base problems related to water treatment. Aqueous-gas phase equilibrium. Aqueous-solid phase equilibrium. Calculation of precipitation potential. Water softening. Water disinfection. Analytical methods related to water quality control, water treatment processes, characterization of water sources and wastewater treatment.
00140320.name: Water Chemistry

00140321.about: Basics in clinical and environmental toxicology. The risk factors of the ecological niche. Tissue and cellular defense mechanisms against the environmental pollutants and the neutralization of their poisonous activities. Understanding the carcinogenic mechanisms through the genetic, biochemical and clinical aspects. classification of carcinogens. The impacts of metals, organic chemicals, fertilizers, and pesticides on the environment and human beings. Chemical compounds and their dispersion in air, soil and water. Nanoparticles and nanotoxicology. Endocrine disruptive xenobiotics and environmental obesogens. Persistent organic pollutants. Environmental  ionizing and non-ionizing radiation. Building, furniture and covering materials (asbestos and others). Fire toxicology. Product stewardship and recycling. risk assessment by means of epidemiologic parameters. Ecological catastrophes.
00140321.name: Environmental Toxicology

00140322.about: Water quality for various uses, potable water quality regulations. principles of water treatment processes. Separation of non-dissolved solids: sedimentation, filtration, flocculation. Gas transfer, disinfection. Separation of dissolved solids. Municipal wastewater characterization, regulations for effluent quality. Wastewater treatment processes: pretreatment, primary sedimentation, biological treatment. Sludge treatment. Effluent reuse.
00140322.name: Water and Wastewater Treatment

00140325.about: Principles of design and operation of water supply systems and wastewater collection. Calculation of water supply networks and wastewater collection systems. Goal, structure and preparation of an engineering project. Objectives of general planning, data collection and processing for design. Techno-economic evaluation and comparison of design alternatives. Topics in water and wastewater systems design. Project of general planning of water treatment and supply system.
00140325.name: Design of Water and Wastewater Systems

00140326.about: Definition of solid wastes: composition and properties, quantities, integrative treatment and disposal. Collection and transportation, transfer stations. Principles of solid  waste recycling. Technologies of separation and classification of waste components. Treatment and disposal: sanitary landfill, composting, treatment- incineration and gasification, pyrolysis and plasmolysis. Thechnologies, design and operation. Biosolids: definitions and treatment technologies.
00140326.name: Technologies Treatment of Solid Wastes

00140327.about: Solutions.Weak acid.base equilibria. Effect of ionic strengh and temperature on equilibrium constants. The carbobnate system. Buffer intensity. Development of equations for the various forms of alkalinity and acidity. Solving of acid-base problems related to water treatment. Aqueous-gas phase equilibrium. Aqueous-solid phase equilibrium. Calculation of precipitation potential. Water softening. Water disinfection. Analytical methods related to water quality control, water treatment processes, characterization of water sources and wastewater treatment. Laboratory coverage of the main analytical techniques used for characterizing water and determining con taminants in water.
00140327.name: Water Chemistry

00140329.about: the need for renewable energy, energy sources and conventional production methods, overview of production pathways from renewable sources, thermodynamics of energy conversion, renewable energy technologies: 1. solar-photo-voltaic and photo-thermal, kinetic wind, hydroelectric and waves, electro-chemical and osmotic. waste-to-energy pathways.
00140329.name: INTRODUCTION TO RENEWABLE ENERGY

00140330.about: oceanography, ecology, and biology of the red sea. the gulf geomorphology, water flow, and the effect on biotic and abiotic characteristics. the role of physical and biological processes on nutrients dynamics. seasonal cycles in primary productivity and biomass of marine communities. fauna and flora of coral reefs and surrounding water.
00140330.name: PROCESSES IN THE RED SEA AND EILAT GULF

00140405.about: Rock forming minerals.  Sedimentary, igneous and metamorphic rocks. Stratigraphy, structural geology and geological mapping.  Abstract of the geology of Israel.  Ground water and reservoirs.  Engineering characteristics of rocks.  Underground openings and supports. Subsurface exploration: exploratory boring, geophysical methods.
00140405.name: Engineering Geology

00140409.about: Volume weight relations, soil classification, flow of water in soil, effective stress, critical gradient and liquefaction, stress distribution, consolidation, compressibility of saturated clay, preconsolidation stress, final settlements time rate of consolidation, shear strenght of solid, lateral earth pressure, slope stability.
00140409.name: Geomechanics

00140411.about: foundation: site investigation, bearing capacity and settlement of shallow foundations, types of piles, pile capacity and settlement under vertical loads, piles under horizontal loads, foundations in swelling clays. slope stability: infinite slope, cullman and taylor methods, slice methods. retaining walls: rankine and coulomb methods for estimating lateral stresses, rigid walls, flexible walls, braced excavations, reinforced earth.
00140411.name: Soil Engineering

00140412.about: basic concepts in determining water quality for various uses. fundamental principles of water treatment processes and overall treatment design.  separation of non-dissolved solids from water: sedimentation, filtration, flocculation. gas transfer, disinfection. separation of dissolved solids. municipal wastewater characterization, regulations for effluent quality. fundamental principles of wastewater treatment processes and overall treatment design. wastewater treatment: pretreatment, primary sedimentation, biological treatment. sludge treatment effluent reuse.
00140412.name: Funda. of Water and Wastewater Treatment

00140501.about: Planning and design of a project in the field of building materials. The work includes: definition of project goals, collection andanalysis of relevant information, proposal and evaluation of alternatives.  The student is required to present a written and oral technical report.
00140501.name: Project in Building Materials

00140503.about: The student can select a laboratory project from the list given by the supervising lecturer. It requires self study of a problem inthe field of building materials, inspecting possible solutions in the lab. Experiments, analysis and summing up the results of the tests.  The student is required to give a lecture and to present a detailed written report. The project may extends for 2 semesters,this part preceding the continuation in 014504.
00140503.name: Lab. Project in Building Materials 1

00140505.about: Classification of cementive materials: material testing and its significance, lime and lime products. Mortars for plastering and renderings. Gypsum and gypsum products: Portland cement - composition types, setting and hardening, structure of the hardened paste and its effect on mechanical properties. Aggregates, mixing water, additives. Fresh concrete, properties of hardened concrete, durability, mix design, concrete technology, testing and quality control, laboratory exercises.
00140505.name: Building Materials

00140506.about: Behavior of concrete in structures: volume changes, cracking and means to reduce its occorrence. Special concrete technologies for in- situ casting as well as for precasting. Solution of a special problem in concrete technology in the laboratory, including: literature survey, visits to building sites or factories as required, preparation of test programs, preliminary tests of materials designof concrete mixes, casting and testing of concrete specimens, evaluation of test results, oral and written report.
00140506.name: Advanced Concrete Technology

00140518.about: the course will provide an overview of different materials used in construction. the course will discuss the broad renge of materials, their properties, components, life cycles, and considerations for their use. students will be acquainted with innovative and advanced technologies in the construction and building materials industry.
00140518.name: Materials 1

00140520.about: introduction to building physics and concept of performance-based design of buildings. basics of mass and heat transfer. heat transfer by conduction, convection, and radiation. hygrothermal comfort in summer and winter. air quality, infiltration, and ventilation.air humidity and vapor transfer through building envelope, preventing condensation and mold growth. energy in building and factors affecting the energy efficiency of the building. israel standards for thermal insulation and energy in buildings. introduction to acoustics, acoustic comfort, and sound insulation in buildings. fire resistance of structures and restricting the spread of fire. in ea ch topic, the following aspects are taught: the physical factors affecting the problem, the characteristics of building materials and building elements, simple analysis, and design methods, the determination of performance criteria and the performance design of details of structure and envelope.
00140520.name: Performance of Buildings-Physi.Climatic

00140600.about: The purpose of this course is to learn how to present a subject in construction management.  Each student collects information fromthe technical literature and other sources.  A written report is submitted and a lecture is given by the student at a seminar meeting.
00140600.name: Seminar in Construction Management

00140601.about: The project is a guided assignment which the student carries out to solve a real life problem in the field of construction management. There are three project options: a. Construction planning of a building project, which includes a selection of the construction method and equipment on the basic of the analysis of alternatives, and preparation of site layout, of schedule and budget for construction. b. Development of a construction venture, which includes  market study, development of investment alternatives, preparation of cash flow for each of them, selection of the most attractive one and a sensitivity analysis. c. Application of automation to a con struction task, which includes the selection of the task, application planning, development of software or hardware and a feasibility analysis.
00140601.name: Project in Construction Management

00140603.about: Elementary economic concepts: supply and demand, cost analysis, comparison of engineering alternatives, economic analysis of equipment use, taxes, inflation, decisions under uncertainty.
00140603.name: Engineering Economics

00140609.about: Introduction to construction equipment, classification, properties and uses of major construction equipment, cranes and other central equipment in the construction of spread-out and high-rise buildings, civil emgineering projects, and above- and underground infrastructure project, equipment costs, hard and soft considerations in equipment selection and operation, production rates, safety in equipment operation, principles of location on the construction site, interrelationships and overall setup of the on-site production array, site layout.
00140609.name: Mechanization and Automation in Construction

00140610.about: The choice of equipment systems. Properties, production rates, and practices of major construction equipment: concrete production and transportation, lifting equipment, earthworks. Owning and operating costs. Industrialized forming systems and their interrelationships with lifting equipment. Factors affecting the selection and operation of construction equipment. Principles of location and site layout. Introduction to automation. Analysis of the construction process in relation to automation. Survey of construction automation applications.
00140610.name: Mechanization and Automation in Construction

00140613.about: Unique characteristics of Construction: organizational structure of firms and projects.  Communications, leadership patterns, motivation, group behaviour, training, performance evaluations, labor relations, site productivity, productivity improvement techniques.
00140613.name: Human Resource Management in Construct.

00140615.name: Introduction to Financial Management in Construction

00140616.about: organizational characteristics of engineering projects. the impact of the information revolution on project management. characteristics of the project manager's work during project implementation. communication and decision making. from management to leadership. models of leadership. developing project managers.
00140616.name: Project Implementation, Management and Leadership

00140617.about: Scheduling, budgeting and controlling construction ptojects through computer integrated methods. Emphasizing decision making processes, based on analysis of alternatives. Discussions include: on-line  project management, scheduling, quantity surveying, cost estimating, cost analysis, budget management, cost flow and cash flow, schedule control and budget control.
00140617.name: Planning and Control of Construction Pr.

00140618.about: Characteristics of the construction industry, procurement protocols, tendering and bidding. Principles of quantity surveying, Critical Path Method, linear project scheduling, and modular projects scheduling. Cost estimating. Selection os equipment, site layout planning, principles of construction safety, quality management in construction.
00140618.name: Int.to Construction Managem. and Safety

00140619.about: PREPARATORY, INFRASTRUCTURE, AND DEVELOPMENT WORKS FOR CONSTRUCTION. CONVENTIONAL METHODS FOR SUBSTRUCTURE, SUPERSTRUCTURE, AND FINISHING WORKS. ELECTRO-MECHANICAL SYSTEMS. BUILDING WATERPROOFING. INDUSTRIALIZATION OF BUILDING FRAME AND FINISHES. TECHNO-ECONOMICAL ANALYSIS OF CONSTRUCTION METHODS. INDUSTRIALIZED CONSTRUCTION - OFFSITE PREFABRICATION AND ONSITE PROCESSES. RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN TECHNOLOGICAL ALTERNATIVES AND MANAGEMENT AND ECONOMICS ASPECTS OF CONSTRUCTION. SAFETY AND QUALITY IN CONSTRUCTION.
00140619.name: Building Construction Methods

00140620.about: principles of structural design. loads, linear and planar components. sizing of components. problem of overall stability. analysis of the load transfer system during constraction and at the final stage. identification of severe design or construction issues. examination of various alternative and the effect of construction on the solution selection. construction methods. lateral stability-lateral load resisting systems. presentation and discussion of failure case studies.
00140620.name: Principles of Structural Des.in Cons.Eng

00140630.about: principles of the israeli legal system, basic concepts: law, regulation, standard, guidelines, division of the construction industry among the various authorities, planning and building law, licensing and uniqueness of operations, principles of safety at work ordinance and work safety regulations, israeli standards and specifications of the standards institution of israel, principles of national.regional.local plans hierarchy, building licensing regulations, the general sales law and the sales (housing) law.
00140630.name: Int. to Legal Aspects in Construction

00140631.about: Project budget throughout all project phases. Estimation and analysis of engineering costs. Estimation and analysis of expropriation costs of infrastructure projects. Estimation and analysis of design and management costs. Budget control and monitoring. Management of project cash flows.
00140631.name: Infrastructure Projects:Cost Estimation

00140632.about: Construction methods of bridges, road pavement, transportation tunneling, soil retaining, railway superstructure. Case studies in core issues in construction management of infrastruture projects, such as: design management, utilities relocation, tendering methodsand considerations of contractor selection, post-tendering unexpected issues, risk management.
00140632.name: Infrastructure Pr:Methods and Managem.

00140702.about: basic principles and data for transportation planning aggregate and disaggregate models for travel behavior and travel demand, minimum path and traffic assignment, analyzing transportation networks, and transport project evaluation. in the lab, students will experience various tools including data analysis, software for network analysis and transportation planning, and estimating disaggregatedemand models.
00140702.name: Transportation Planning

00140709.about: Tests of pavement materials. Moisture density relationships. C.B.R. Flakiness and elongation, Los Angeles abrasion. Sand equivalent, gradation specific gravity, Alterberg limits, standard bitumen tests, Marshall test.
00140709.name: Highway Materials Lab.

00140710.about: Design strategies. Types of distress and serviceability. Vehicle and traffic considerations. Environment. Field investigation. Characterization of subgrade, sub-base, base and asphalt concrete materials. Stresses in flexible pavements. Design methods: CBR method and introduction to rational methods.
00140710.name: Flexible Pavement Design

00140714.about: Principles of design and operation of highway facilities: signing and marking, lighting, guard rails.  Parking facilities and passenger terminals, mode transfer facilities, pedestrian facilities, signals.
00140714.name: Design of Traffic Facilities

00140719.about: planning and design of a transportation project. the student can select a project from the list given by the supervising lecturer. self study of an engineering problem, definition of objectives, creation of alternatives evaluation, selection of preferred alternative, detailed design, preparation of a detailed final report. the project extends for 2 semesters.
00140719.name: Extended Project in Transportation Part1

00140720.about: planning and design of a transportation project. the student can select a project from the list given by the supervising lecturer. self study of an engineering problem, definition of objective, creation of alternatives evaluation, selection of preferred alternative, detailed design, preparation of a detailed final report. the project extends for 2 semesters.
00140720.name: Extended Project in Transportation Part2

00140721.about: planning and design of a transportation project. self study of an engineering problem, definition of objectives, creation of alternatives, evaluation, selection of preferred alternative, detailed design, preparation of a detailed final report.
00140721.name: Project in Transportation Planning

00140722.about: planning and design of a traffic engineering project. self study of an engineering problem, definition of objectives, creation of alternatives, evaluation, selection of preferred alternative, detailed design, preparation of a detailed final report.
00140722.name: Project in Traffic Engineering

00140723.about: planning and design of geometrical road aspects project. self study of an engineering problem, definition of objectives, creation of alternatives, evaluation, selection of preferred alternative, detailed design, preparation of a detailed final report.
00140723.name: Project in Geometric Road Design

00140724.about: planning and design of a road pavement project. self study of an engineering problem, definition of objectives, creation of alternatives, evaluation, selection of preferred alternative, detailed design, preparation of a detailed final report.
00140724.name: Project in Pavement Design

00140725.about: Principle of operations and geometric design of rail systems. Wheel - Track relations, systems electrification principles, capacityestimation, alignment and station design of rail facilities, international rail standards.
00140725.name: Introduction to Railway Transportation

00140726.about: road safety, analysis of road crash data, road safety audits, safety considerations in geometric design of roads and intersections,sight distances, safe design of traffic arrangements, safety devices, ministry of transportation guidelines and procedures.
00140726.name: Road Safety - Audits and Devices

00140728.about: Introduction and goals: national, metropolitan and urban transportation networks. Road network hierarchy, freeways and interchanges, infrastructure for pedestrians and bicycles, infrastructure for public transportation. Mass transit systems - rail, lrt and brt. The parking system, transportation management. Various infrastructures in the "rights of way", the statutorial and engineering planning and design process: implementation of a transportation project.
00140728.name: Transportation Infrastructures Design

00140730.about: The transportation system, its components and the inter-relations among them. Impact on economic growth, urban form, and the environment. The transportation planning process, trip generation and attraction, trip distribution, principles of traffic assignment. Traffic flow characteristics, capacity and level of service, geometric design of highways, horizontal and vertical curves.
00140730.name: Int. to Transportation Engineering

00140731.about: Roles, needs and design requirements. Types, definitions and terminology. Overview of asphalt pavement construction process. Pavement distress. Pavement materials. Environmental aspects. Traffic loads. Introduction to pavement mechanics. Pavement design approaches.
00140731.name: Introduction to Pavement Design

00140733.about: human, vehicle and road as factors traffic. traffic flow characteristics. traffic data measurements. traffic flow models and shock wave theory. operational assessment,delay and capacity of unsignalized and signalized intersections. traffic light design for isolated intersections, coordinated signalized intersections and green waves, and public transportation priority.
00140733.name: Traffic Engineering and Management

00140734.about: THE COURSE PRESENTS A BASIC OVERVIEW OF PUBLIC TRANSIT PLANNING AND OPERATION. AMONG THE TOPICS COVERED ARE: BASIC DEFINITIONS AND CONCEPTS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT PLANNING, TECHNOLOGIES AND THEIR ROLE, PLANNING DESIGN, PLANNING SERVICE STANDARDS, SERVICE FUNCTION AND LINE COMMENTARY, PUBLIC TRANSPORT PRIORITY, PUBLIC TRANSPORT (SIMULATION) ROLES, PUBLIC TRANSPORT OPERATIONAL FACILITIES, AND THE RELIABILITY OF SERVICE.
00140734.name: Public Transportation

00140779.about: geometric design of highways: horizontal alignment, vertical alignment, at grade intersection design: introduction and general principles, right and left turn channelization, traffic islands, sight distance. roundabouts: geometric design and capacity assessment. unconventional intersection design. operational assessment, delay, capacity and level of service of freeways, weaving sections, ramps, acceleration and deceleration lanes and two-lane highways.
00140779.name: Geometric Design and Highways Operation

00140814.about: Redundant observations and the method of least squares.  The mathematical model. Adjustment by parameters: observation and normal equations. Adjustment by conditions. Weights, variance of unit weight, covariance matrix. Plane coordinates adjustment. Orientation unknown. Error ellipse. Adjustment of levelling traverse and triangulation nets. Adjustment by conditions with unknowns.
00140814.name: Adjustment Computations 1

00140829.about: The land law: (registration of rights). Classification and systems of land registration. Partnership in land. The survey Ordnance and surveying regulations for plans for registration purposes and topographical maps. The planning and construction law. Registrationof public dwelling units. Confiscation of land for public use. The surveyor and the planner.
00140829.name: Survey Law

00140831.about: Surveying and computations for land registration and topographic mapping. Division computations with geometric and town-planning consideration. Drawing a division plan according to survey regulations. Duration: one week at the beginning of summer semester.
00140831.name: Cadastral Survey Camp.

00140841.about: The shape of the earth. Geodetic coordinates systems. Higher geodesy and surveying. Geodetic information sources: terastrial measurements, airial photographs, satellites (GPS) and remote sensing. Basic issues in the theory of errors. The theodolite and angle measurements. Direct and indirect methods of distance measurements. Ordinary leveling. Planimetric and topographic surveying (GIS). Calculation of areas and volumes.
00140841.name: Fundamentals of Mapping and Surveying 1

00140842.about: Plane coordinates computations: traverses, intersection and resection. Advanced issues in the theory of errors: weight of observations, error elipse, error propagation in traverses. Setting out of straight lines, circular, transitional and vertical curves. Spherical trigonometry.
00140842.name: Fundamentals of Mapping and Surveying 2

00140843.about: Introductory review. The central projection as a mathematical model of photograph. 2nd and 3rd coordinates transformation. photo coordinates measurment. The rules of collinearity  and coplanarity. Relative and absolute orientation. Spatial intersection and resection with photographs. Interior and exterior orientation of a photogrammetric model. Basic principles of aerial triangulation. Planning of a photogrammetric project.
00140843.name: Photogrammetry 1

00140845.about: Introduction to programming in the fields of geodesy and mapping. methods of  representation of mapping data in the computer. Vector and raster representation. Types of entities and basic operations in vector representation. Methods for graphic presentation of raster image. Introduction to algorithms in the field of computer graphics.
00140845.name: Introduction to Computerized Mapping

00140846.about: Data files and databases. Hierarchial, network and relational databases. Object oriented database. Planimetric and altimetric information, representation and management. Sorting geospatial data - points, polylines and closed polygons - equal area and equal volumetechniques. Triangulation and voronoi polygons. Usage of databases in geodesy. Different techniques for data allocation.
00140846.name: Geospatial Databases

00140848.about: Terrestrial and astronomical coordinate systems. The laws of planetary motion. The motion of the earth and the stars as a function of time. Time systems. Satellite orbital motion. Forces acting on a satellite of the earth. State vectors and osculating orbits. Global positioning system, absolute and relative positioning. Fundamentals of physical geodesy.
00140848.name: Introduction to Geodesy

00140849.about: The ellipsoid as a reference surface. Computations on the ellipsoid surface. Solutions of direct and inverse problems. Datum definition of a geodetic systems. Datum transformations. Geodetic and projection-plane coordinates. Cassini's projection. Conformal projections. Transverse mercator (UTM projection) and the conformal conic projection. Stereo-graphic projections.
00140849.name: Mathematical Geodesy

00140851.about: Methods for the establishment, survey and management of vertical, horizontal and combined (3d) control networks. Triangulation, trilateration, traverse networks, precise leveling, trigonometric leveling - measurements, computation, adjustment computations and error analysis. The global positioning system (GPS), neasurements, observation equations, point positioning. Application of static GPS measurements for the establishment and maintenance of control networks.
00140851.name: Geodetic Control Networks

00140852.about: The global positioning system (GPS) as a primary tool for engineering surveying, photogrammetry and GIS. Surveying with GPS: static, fast static, kinematic, stop and go and real time kinematic (RTK). GPS data processing software. GPS network adjustment and conversion between networks.
00140852.name: GPS Surveying

00140853.about: Precise geodetic measurements for construction of dams, bridges, high rise buildings, and tunnels. Monitoring deformations by precise geodetic measurements. Using lasers and gyroscopes in engineering surveying. fundamentals of optical tooling.
00140853.name: Special Engineering Surveys

00140855.about: Introduction to image processing. Image enhancement: histogram equalization, filtering and smoothing, edge enhancement. Edge detection and segmentation. Representation and analysis of images at varying resolution. Characteristics and introduction to processing ofscanned maps, digital aerial photographs and satellite imagery. Basics of image pattern recognition, basics of computer vision.
00140855.name: Image Processing for Mapping

00140856.about: 3D data of the terrain: regular and irregular information, topographical discontinuity, spatial information of urban areas. Interpolation of 3d data and terrain. Line of sight and dead areas. Isometric and perspective projections. Visibility techniques. Contours processing. 3d aspects of the internet. 3d aspects of the israeli surveying regulation.
00140856.name: Digital Terrain Modelling

00140857.about: Integrated vector and.or raster 2D and 3D GIS. Organizing data in layers, geodatabases, fields and objects. Quality assessment, quality control, standards and metadata. Information retrieval with queries, spatial analysis and knowledge creation. Analysis of networks, time and dynamic phenomenon. Presentation of information as maps and reports. Representation and aplication of the terrain. Principles of GIS project implementation with emphasis on engineering applications.
00140857.name: Geographic Information Systems 1

00140859.about: Nautical navigation - charts, navigation systems. Hydrography- standards, measuring equipment. Horizontal control at sea - nauticalnavigation. Hydrographic surveying - planning and reporting. Tide measurements adjustments. Sound velocity in water influence on soundings.
00140859.name: Hydrographic Surveying

00140863.about: Field surveying, computations and drawing for the preparation of a topographical map according to govermental regulations. Duration: two weeks at the beginning of summer semester.
00140863.name: Surveying Camp 1

00140864.about: The students carry out complete horizontal and vertical control surveys of high precision that include triangulation, trilateration, GPS measurements and precise leveling. The field work is followed by computations, adjustment, error analysis and presentation of the results. Duration: two and a half weeks at the beginning of the summer semester.
00140864.name: Surveying Camp 2

00140866.about: Presentation of a technical subject in one of the fields of digital mapping. The student is independently conducting an advanced study on the chosen subject, collecting data and information from the literature and delivers his summary as an oral presentation and in writing.
00140866.name: Seminar in Mapping and Geo-Information

00140867.about: The student carries out a project (analysis and computer applications) in one of the branches of geodetic engineering: satellite geodesy, engineering surveys, cadastral surveys, mathematical geodesy, and physical geodesy. Emphasis is placed on independent study of a geodetic problem, application of previous studies, comparison of different solutions, applying a selected solution, preparing a technical report.
00140867.name: Project in Geodesy and Surveying 1

00140868.about: Application of advanced instrumentation and surveying (field, laboratory and office) to a geodetic project. The emphasis is on independent study, familiarization with instruments and their operation, design of observation procedures according to requirements, performance of observations and their analysis, final report.
00140868.name: Advanced Project in Mapping and Geo-Info

00140869.about: Planning and executing of a project in one of the digital mapping fields: cartography and computer assisted mapping, photogrammetryand remote sensing, geographic information systems. The project will include choosing a subject, study of background, planning of implementation, and execution of the practical work. summery of the stages of the project and the resulting conclusions will be submitted in a detailed report.
00140869.name: Project in Digital Mapping 1

00140877.about: Cartographical communication, cartographic data types, GIS principles, vector and raster representation of data, symbolization, linking thematic information to cartographic objects, generalization, map accuracy cartographic projections, map production within GIS environment, geographical enquiries wuth GIS.
00140877.name: Cartography and Introduction to Gis

00140878.about: Geometric algorithms for geo-spatial data processing. Data structures for geographic vector and raster maps. Cell topology as a means for vector data management. Introduction to geographic data acquisition: data sources, analysis, presentation.
00140878.name: Computer Aided Mapping

00140879.about: Data acquisition methods: active sensors - Lidar and Radar. Passive sensors in different spectral bands. Representation of thematicdata and presentation of local, linear and polygonal information. Representation and modeling of temporal phenomenon. Analysis thematic data and overlay of two or more thematic layers. Case studies, information extraction and compilation of thematic geomorphologic and land cover data from active and passive sensory data.
00140879.name: Thematic Mapping

00140880.about: Introduction to documentation and conservation of cultural heritage sites: concepts, and an overview of traditional construction techniques and architectural details. Cultural heritage mapping techniques - traditional surveying, photogrammetry, laser scanning based three-dimensional mapping. Selection of appropriate mapping techniques for documentation purposes. Workshop in mapping and documentation of a cultural heritage site.
00140880.name: Workshop in Cultural Heritage Documenta.

00140881.about: The shape of the earth. Geodetic coordinates systems. Higher geodesy and surveying. Geodetic information sources: terastrial measurements, airial photographs, satellites (GPS) and remote sensing. Basic issues in the theory of errors. The theodolite and angle measurements. Direct and indirect methods of distance measurements. ordinary leveling. Planimetric and topographic surveying (GIS). Calculation of areas and volumes.
00140881.name: Fundamentals of Surveying and Mapping 1G

00140882.about: Laws associated with land management. Surveyors regulations. Involved agencies. Land arrangement. Real estate registeation. Mutations in the registry. Urban planning. Land types. Land designation and use. Building rights. Land appraisal elements. Real estate acquisitions, leasing, rental. Expropriation. Land taxation principles. Financial systems, planning boards and local government. The surveyor rights and duties.
00140882.name: Land Administration

00140885.about: Broadening and deepening the knowledge in cadastral issues: technical specifications and formats for submission of plans, reconstruction of cadastral boundaries in practice in a variety of scenarios and resolution of conflicts between background plans. Adjustmentof redundant observations in cadastre, transformations between networks and stitching blocks together. Image analysis for cadastre applications, determination of right of way and easements. Quality control and auditing of registration plans. Registration mutationplans and registration plans at the land registry. Calculating areas of apartments: municipal bylaws for determining property taxes,  defining and reporting of built-up areas in residential real estate assessments.
00140885.name: Cadastre 2

00140888.about: Land registration systems in Israel. Regulations regarding the mutations and preparation of plans for registration purposes. Reparcelation according to the planning and construction law. Preparation of town planning regarding registration purposes. Reconstructionof parcel boundairies. Elements of land management and taxation in Israel. Analytical cadastre.
00140888.name: Cadastre 1

00140889.about: ADVANCED IMAGE ORIENTATION METHODS. LINE BASED PHOTOGRAMMETRY. 2-D AND 3-D PROJECTIVITY AND THE HOMOGENEOUS REPRESENTATION. OPTICS AND CAMERA CALIBRATION. REPRESENTATIONS OF ROTATION MATRICES. LINEAR MODELS IN PHOTOGRAMMETRY. EPIPOLAR GEOMETRY - THE ESSENTIAL ANDFUNDAMENTAL MATRICES. EPIPOLAR RECTIFICATION. VANISHING POINTS AND THEIR APPLICATION. SINGLE VIEW METROLOGY AND 3-D RECONSTRUCTION.
00140889.name: Photogrammetry 2

00140890.about: THE COURSE AIMS AT TEACHING THE FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICAL PRINCIPLES UNDERLYING REMOTE SENSING  AND DEVELOPING SKILLS AT TRANSFORMING A SPECTRAL IMAGE INTO MAP. THE TOPICS INCLUDE: RADIATION INTERACTION WITH PARTICULATE MATTER, TRANSMITTANCE, ABSORBANCE AND REFLECTANCE, ATMOSPHERIC EFFECTS, LAMBERT LAW, VOLUMETRIC SCATTERING, SPECTRAL REFLECTANCE FROM LEAVES AND SOILS, SPECTRAL CLASSIFICATION, SENSING SYSTEMS.
00140890.name: Int.to Spectroscopy and Remote Sensing

00140935.about: Measurement standards. Terms: measurement, accuracy, bias, eror uncertainty, SI-units, hierarchy, traceability, repeatability, calibration of global system, resolving power, probability of detection, detection limit. Uncertainty calculation according to iso. Noise characterization. Experiment planning and analysis. Basic measuring decices and experiments on: temperature, flow, light intensity, strain, heat transfer.
00140935.name: Measurement Systems

00140940.about: The course focuses of the following topics: introduction to transport phenomena, energy conservation equaltion, heat conduction, heat convection, phase change, mass transfer. Applications related the environmental and agricultural engineering and sciences will bediscussed.
00140940.name: Transport Phenomena in Bio.and Envir.Sys

00140941.about: basins and drainage concentration points, soil properties, hydrology-upper drainage, subsurface drainage (hooghoudt and ernst), hydraulics-in tunnels, culverts and subsurface drainage pipes, technical drawing of structures. design programs hec-ras and hy-8. toursin the field and in a pipe factory. final project-including bill and quantities preparation.
00140941.name: Drainage Engineering

00140942.about: practical aspects os water balances, flow schemes and resistance curves, economic considerations, fundamental concepts in design ofopen conduits, channels, lagoons, reservoirs, bores, pumping stations, water diversion, dams, runners.chutes, ebergy dissipation constructions, slope stability, seepage and water losses from reservoirs, reservoir lining, earth works.
00140942.name: Hydraulic Engi. and Reservoirs

00140943.about: basic knowledge of analoge and digital electrobic systems, acquaintance with measurement equipment and oscilloscope, the analog computer and its operation. measurement of physical variables. data acquisition methods and real time data handling. modelling and identification of the laboratory system (two water tanks in series). sampling and the sampling theorem. anti-aliasing filter. analog p,pi-control of the laboratory system. digital p, pi, high order control and state feedback control of the laboratory system. implementation of the kalman filter.
00140943.name: Control Laboratory

00140952.about: Soil proming processes. Methods of soil classification. Majur soil groups world wide. Israeli soils. Evalnating land for agriculture and engineering goals. The relationship between soil and climate properties and agricultural plannings. Excution of land survey.
00140952.name: Land-Use Survey-Information Systems

00140954.about: The aim of this course is to provide the student with the basic concepts of meteorology in general and micrometeorology in particular, stressing agricultural applications.  Study of the processes of momentum, energy and mass transfer near the ground leads to quantitative solutions of problems related to the surface energy balance. Chapters: radiative heat transfer, solar radiation, long wave radiation, momentum transfer, mixing length, logarithmic wind profile, canopy flow, atmospheric stability, Richardson's number, convective transfer, soil heat  flow, energy balance.
00140954.name: Introduction to Atmospheric Physics

00140956.about: soil texture, clay minerals, formation and classification of soil, double layer, ion exchange and ion adsorption, flocculation- dispersion, calcareous, saline and acid soils, soil organic matter, nitrogen cycle, plant nutrition, agricultural activity and environmental pollution.
00140956.name: Introduction to Soil Chemistry

00140966.about: Research or design project in environmental engineering. Self study of scientific.engineering problem, comparison between differentalternatives, or planning scientific methodology, detailed design of one alternative and technical report, or experimental work, data analysis and conclusions.
00140966.name: Project 2 in Env. Eng.

00140972.about: Definitions and classification of hydraulic machines. Rotodynamic pumps, elements of pumps.  Theory of impeller, Euler's Theorem.  Pump characteristics.  Pumping system. Working point and domain.  Pumps connected in series and in parallel.  Stretch-characteristiccalculation of open and closed networks.  Abnormal pump operation. Pump-engine aggregates. Water-hammer.
00140972.name: Pumps and Pumping Systems

00140977.about: An introduction to soil physics including a description of water in soils, a definition of porous media continuum, and understanding the transport phenomena of water, gases and solutes in soils. The course topics include soil water properties, capillarity, water retention, soil water hydrostatics, Darcy Law, hydraulic conductivity, conservation equations of saturated and unsaturated flows, infiltration, transport of salts and pollutants, evapo- transpiration and gas transport, computation and measurement techniques.
00140977.name: Int. to Flow and Pollution in Soils

00140978.about: system ecology: the ecosystem as a themodynamic system, foodwebs, primary production, ecosystem energetics, biogeochemical cycles, global changes. population ecology: logistic growth, predation, competition, parasitism, mutualism. meta-populations. dynamic population models. vegetation dynamics. spatio-temporal patterns of species diversity. the biodiversity crisis.
00140978.name: The basics of Ecology

00150001.about: the importance of plants. genetic and environmental regulation of plant development. toxicity, transport, metabolism and plant storage of a biotic pollutants such as  salinity, heavy metals and organic  molecules from soils and irrigation water. use of plants forremediation of environmental pollution. use of transgenic plants.
00150001.name: Plants and Environment

00150007.about: Force and moment systems, free body diagram, equilibrium of systems in plane and space. Distributed forces, center of gravity and moment of inertia. Friction. Principle of virtual work. shear, axial-force and bending moment diagram. Definition of stress and strain, stresses transformation, principal stresses. constitutive laws of engineering and biological materials. Failure criteria. an introduction to elasticity, plasticity and viscoelasticity.
00150007.name: Applied Mechanics 1

00150017.about: Development of equipment and methods in earthmoving as a factor in civil engineering, agricultural and mining projects.  Propertiesof moved soil and rock.  Power and forces for excavating and earth hauling.  Machine components and their performance:  diesel engines, power-trains, tracks and tires.  Equipment application and production: rippers, excavators and shovels.  Levelling equipment.  Principles of soil compaction, selection of rollers.  Mass-haul diagrams and their interpretation.  Machine loading and handling analysis in equipment operation and earth-works.  Safety in earthmoving.
00150017.name: Earthmoving Equipment & Systems

00150019.about: Linear systems, single input.single output and linearization. Open-loop dynamic response. Laplace transform and transfer functions.Stability analysis and criteria. Introduction to analog simulation. Root locus design technique. Frequency response (Bode, Nyquist)- compensation network synthesis. P-Pi-Pid - controllers. State space description of dynamic systems. State feedback. State reconstruction.
00150019.name: Introduction to Control

00160101.about:
THE COURSE INTRODUCES THE FIRE PROBLEM IN STRUCTURES AND THE IMPORTANCE OF FIRE SAFETY IN BUILDINGS WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF THE OVERALL FIRE SAFETY. THE COURSE ALSO INTRODUCES THE CAUSES OF FIRE! FIRE DEVELOPMENT AND THE DIFFERENT STAGES OF FIRE! PARAMETRS CONSIDERED IN FIRE RESISTANCE! AND CODES AND STANDARDS. THE COURSE COVERS THE BEHAVIOR OF STRUCTURES UNDER FIRE! STRUCTURES  RESISTANCE CHARACTERISTICS! THE METHODS FOR ASSESSING FIRE RESISTANCE INCLUDING TEST METHODS AND CALCULATION METHODS. THE COURSE ALSO COVERS DESIGNSTRUCTURES FOR FIRE INCLUDING STEEL! CONCRETE AND MASONRY! AND TIMBER STRUCTURES. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE COURSE ARE AS FOLLOWS: TO UN DERSTAND THE BEHAVIOR OF STRUCTURAL SYSTEMS AND MATERIALS UNDER FIRE EFFECTS! TO GAIN AN EDUCATIONAL AND COMPREHENSIVE EXPERIENCE ON THE FIRE RESISTANCE DESIGN CONCEPTS! TO LEARN BASIC FIRE SAFETY DESIGN ISSUES! TO APPLY RATIONAL DESIGN METHODOLOGIES FOR FIRE RESISTANCE DESIGN.
 LEARNING OUTCOMES: BY THE END OF THIS COURSE! THE STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO CALCULATE/DETERMINE:
 1. TIME-TEMP RELATIONSHIPS FOR POST-FLASHOVER FIRES.
 2. EQUIVALENT FIRE SEVERITY/ FIRE RESISTANCE.
 3. MATERIAL PROPERTIES AT ELEVATED TEMPERATURES.
4. TEMPE
00160101.name: TOPICS IN STRUCTURAL BEHAVIOR UNDER FIRE

00160102.about: THE COURSE INTRODUCES ENGINEERING DESIGN OPTIMIZATION METHODS AND ALGORITHMS. THESE CONSTITUTE A SET OF POWERFUL COMPUTERIZED DESIGN TOOLS FOR A VARIETY OF ENGINEERING APPLICATIONS. THE COURSE FOCUSES ON FUNDAMENTAL TOPICS IN ENGINEERING OPTIMIZATION, WITH A PARTICULAR ATTENTION TO STRUCTURAL ENGINEERING APPLICATIONS. COURSE CONTENT: FUNDAMENTAL MATHEMATICAL OPTIMIZATION CONCEPTS, MATHEMATICAL REPRESENTATION OF AN OPTIMIZATION PROBLEM, FORMULATIONS OF STRUCTURAL OPTIMIZATION PROBLEMS. LOCAL/GLOBAL OPTIMUM, CONVEXITY, KKT CONDITIONS FOR A LOCAL OPTIMUM. PLASTIC DESIGN BY LINEAR PROGRAMMING. SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS FOR STATIC PROBLEMS: FINITE DIFFERENCES, C OMPLEX STEP, AUTOMATIC DIFFERENTIATION, DIRECT DIFFERENTIATION, AND ADJOINT METHOD. ELASTIC DESIGN OF TRUSSES BY LINEAR PROGRAMMINGAND OPTIMALITY CRITERIA. IMPLEMENTATION OF SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS FOR GRADIENT-BASED STATIC RESPONSE OPTIMIZATION OF A FRAME STRUCTURE. SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS FOR TRANSIENT PROBLEMS. TRANSIENT OPTIMIZATION OF FRAME STRUCTURES. OPTIMIZATION OF OFFSHORE WIND FARMS. HEURISTIC ALGORITHMS FOR DESIGN OPTIMIZATION (E.G. GENETIC ALGORITHMS). MULTIOBJECTIVE OPTIMIZATION. LEARNING OUTCOMES: AT THE END OF THE COURSE THE
00160102.name: INTRODUCTION TO ENGINEERING OPTIMIZATION

00160111.about: materials, equipment and prestressing methods, principles of prestressing, analysis of prestressing (service limit state), geometryof cables and eqvivalent loads, prestressing losses, deformations, strength in bending and shear ultimate limit state, anchoraging zones, composite sections (precast and cast in place concrete), project on a prestressed element.
00160111.name: Prestressed Concrete

00160122.about:
effects of explosions, detonation and deflagration, blast loads in various environments, free-field and confined explosions, nonlinear dynamic sdof analysis, analytical and numerical solution of the equations of motion, behavior of materials under high strain rates, design philosophy and criteria, failure modes of rc and steel structures, pressure-impulse diagrams, progressive collapse.
 learning outcomes: by the end of the course the students will be:
 1. familiar with the design philosophy of structures under blast and impact loads, and the design criteria.
 2. able to evaluate the effects of explosives and dynamic loads on structures.
 3. able to an alyze structures considering the phenomena associated with dynamic loads.
 4. able to assess failure modes as a function of the parameters of the load.
00160122.name: STRUCTURES UNDER BLAST AND IMPACT

00160124.about: analysis and design of reinforced concrete spatial structures and their supporting elements, folded plates hyper shells and water tanks.
00160124.name: Spatial Structures

00160142.about: introduction to engineering seismology, geotechnical aspects of earthquake engineering, nonlinear response spectra, philosophy of seismic design of structures, behavior, analysis and design of yielding structures under earthquakes, seismic design of reinforced concrete structures, seismic design of steel structures, concepts of using energy dissipation devices and seismic isolation of structures.
00160142.name: Earthquake Engineering

00160143.about: properties of materials. bonding (demonstrated in laboratory test). stadium i and ii analysis of cross-sections. calculations of deflections in linear elements with equivalent parameters and moment- curvature curvature curves (with a uniform compression stress). crack width calculations. flexural behavior of under and over- reinforced beams (demonstrated in laboratory tests). interaction diagrams (with a uniform compression stress) and second order curvature in colums. partially loaded areas. behavior of beams under predominant shear loads (demonstrated in laboratory test). introduction to stm (strut-and-tie method) - corbels.
00160143.name: Concrete Structures 3

00160144.about: foundation of elasticity and plate theories. structural discretization and the finite elements concept. finite elements for struts and beams. plane and plate elements. 3d elements, numerical techniques in finite element analysis.
00160144.name: Finite Elements

00160203.about: Mathematical models of water resources systems.  Selection of models for optimization and simulation. Model structures. Objective functions. Formulation of optimization and simulation models. Methods of solution. Examples, including:  development of surface water, aquifer management, design and operation of distribution systems.
00160203.name: Water Resources Systems Engineering 1

00160206.about: Kinematics: The rate of strain tensor, the vorticity tensor, vortex lives and circulation stresses in flow field: Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids. Lagrange and Euler approaches: System and control volume, equations of property conservation, Boussinesq approximation. Viscous flow: Navier-Stokes equations, analytical and numerical solutions. Potential flow theory: Function theory, analyticaland numerical solutions. Introduction to turbulence: Averaged equations of motion, turbulent diffusion, Reynolds analogy. Boundary layers: Boundary layer theory, laminar and turbulent boundary layers, turbulent heat and mass transfer.  Environmental flows: Flow in  conduits, atmospheric flows, marine and ocean flows, flow in porous media.
00160206.name: Environmental Fluid Mechanics

00160208.about: Physical parameters in the marine environment, tides, waves, currents, littoral sediment transport and coastal morphology, interaction between coastal structures and marine environment, coastal protection seawalls, revetments and breakwaters, hydrographical measurements and data analysis.
00160208.name: Marine Engineering

00160209.about: Development of harbours and shipping. Principles and methods of design. Design data. Design of general plans. Hydraulic models ( physical and numerical ) breakwaters. Ship maneuvering, approach channel and turning circle. Equipment and methods for dredging and reclamation structures of piers and jetties. Maintenance of port structures. Cargo handling types of cargo equipment for loading and unloading.
00160209.name: Port and Coastal Engineering

00160210.about: Basic equations and approximations, solutions for small waves, wave energy and momentum, waves on currents and wave action, ship waves, refraction and diffraction, waves in shallow water and on beaches.
00160210.name: Water Waves

00160211.about: Definition of the watershed system. Revision of rainfall and runoff processes. Infiltration. Definition of rainfall excess and surface runoff. The use of the unit hydrograph. Methods for the analysis of the relationship between surface runoff and rainfall excess.Hydrologic models. Synthetic generation of hydrological data.
00160211.name: Hydrology of Surface Runoff

00160220.about: topics: physical oceanography: the properties of water (temperature salinity) and their dynamic  (currents waves, tides). the physics of the ocean and its role in the climate system, currents and waves forecast. the course will include a half day scientific cruise for data collection and rotating tank experiments in the lab.
00160220.name: Physical Oceanography

00160223.about:
basics of subsurface hydrology, balance equations, solutions for steady and transient conditions, pumping tests, solute transport, advection and dispersion, analytic and numeric solutions, reactive transport, aquifer remediation. learning outcomes: at the end of the course the student will: 1. know to formulate groundwater motion problems and to analytically solve simpli fied problems
 2. know to formulate solute transport problem in porous media, and to analytically solve simpilfied problems. 3. be familiar with several soil and groundwater remediation techniques
00160223.name: Groundwater: Flow, Transport and Remediation

00160302.about: Primary air pollutants - sources and effects. Physical and chemical properties of aerosols. Secondary pollutants, photochemical reactions, formation and removal of gasses and particles. Global air pollution, meteorology of air pollution. Evaluation and monitoringof ambient air: air pollution control - administrative and technological aspects.
00160302.name: Air Pollution

00160303.about: Principles of sampling and analysis of gaseous and particulate pollutants. Determination of total suspended particles, soiling index, sulfates, lead particles, nitrates and chlorides. Determination of SO2 and nitrogen oxides. Rain chemical composition. Application of electron microscopy to study particle size, morphology and elemental content. Use of gas chromatography to enalyze organic compounds.
00160303.name: Air Pollution Laboratory

00160304.about: the course will cover meteorological phenomena and their relationships to air quality issues. topics to be covered include: meteorological phenomena at various spatiotemporal scales, israeli weather systems, the planetary boundary layer, turbulence, logarithmic wind profile heat and matter fluxes in the atmosphere, canopy flow, cloud physics and precipitation learning outcomes: at the end of the course the student will: 1. be familiar with different meteorological phenomena with different spatiotemporal scales. 2. be familiar with the main models to describethese phenomena. 3. be able to solve quantitative problems based on the above models. 4. be able  to analyze and present in class scientific texts that discuss the above issues. 5. be able to discuss the relationships between meteorological phenomena at varying spatiotemporal scales and air pollution
00160304.name: Advanced Topics in Atmospheric Physics

00160328.about: membrane structure and properties. classification of pressure driven membrane separation. fluid dynamics, mathematical models for uf and mf, nf and ro. performance and design. operation modes, energy requirements. laboratory and industrial equipment. fouling and cleaning. effluent organic matter, biofouling. applications: tertiary and quaternary treatment, mbr, greywater, zld.
00160328.name: Membrane Separation in Wastewater Treatm

00160329.about: Basic concepts in physics, chemistry and biology of water. General aspects of limnology and oceanography. Primary production and food chains in water bodies. General physiology of different water creatures. Algae and their importance to man. Chemical cycles in different water bodies. Eutrophication processes in lakes and estuaries. Water pollution and its effects on the environment. Understanding Biological and Physical processes in the oceans.
00160329.name: Hydrobiology

00160337.about: fundamentals of electrochemistry: oxidation-reduction reactions, electrochemical potentials, electrode reactions, thermodynamics and kinetics of electrochemical reactions water and wastewater treatment: electrodialysis, capacitive deionization, electrooxidation, recovery of metals, sensors energy conversion and storage: fuel cells, redox flow batteries, supercapacitors learning outcom: at theend of the course the student will 1. know the basic principles and laws of the electrochemistry science. 2. know the most important existing and future electrochemical processes aimed at water and wastewater treatment, electrical energy conversion and storage, an d on site production of raw chemicals. 3. be able to make a principle design of different types of electrochemical reactors.
00160337.name: Environmental Electrochemistry

00160338.about: major types, composition, and production rates of solid wastes, regulation in israel and oecd countries, collection and transportation of solid wastes, landfilling, leachates, anaerobic digestion, biogas, separation (trommel, ballistic separator, eddy currents separator etc.) and recycling, composting, thermal treatment (e.g., incineration, pyrolysis, gasification, plasms treatment), visit tosolid wastes disposal facility. the composition of final grade: home works 51pr. report on visit to solid wastes disposal facilities and project- 01pr., final examination - 57pr. learning outcomes: the students will learn major aspects of solid wastes management a nd treatment processes, types, composition, and production rates of solid wastes, regulation in israel and oecd countries, collection and transportation of solid wastes, landfilling, leachates, anaerobic digestion, biogas, separation (trommel, ballistic separator, eddy currents separator etc.) and recycling, composting, thermal treatment (e.g., incineration, pyrolysis, gasification, plasms treatment),  visit to solid wastes disposal facility. facility.
00160338.name: SOLID WASTES TREATMENT

00160339.about: the chemical and biological fate of pollutants in the environment. pollutant adsorption, solubilization.precipitation and transformation processes in soils.water and the environmental conditions that control them. biological degradation of pollutants: main pathways and enzymes the impact of the pollutant chemical structure on biodegradation. predicting the degradation pathway of pollutants learning outcomes: at the end of the course the student will know: 1. the prevalent and relevant pollutants and their physicochemical properties. 2. the main interactions in soil and water including adsorption, solubilization, complexation, redox transformations and biological degradation, understanding the environmental conditions that control these processes. 3. how to construct an adsorption isotherm and how to fit  curves to the commonly applied models 4. understanding the importance of the kinetics of adsorption and solubilization . precipitation processes using the different models introduced. 5. an understanding of the redox chain in soils and aquifers and its connection to pollutant transformation. 6. in depth knowledge of the main enzyme families and degradation pathways fordegradation o
00160339.name: Fate of Pollutants in the Environment

00160403.about: The course introduces the fundamentals of rock mechanics while emphasizing practical rock engineering applications. Rock mechanics principles are used to explain selected geological and geotechnical phenomena. Rock mechanics principles are applied to the design of engineering structures.
00160403.name: Introduction to Rock Mechanics

00160421.about: In situ testing of soils.  Standard penetration.  Cone penetration, shear vane, dilatometer testing.  Pressurementer testing. Piezameters. Tilt and deformation. Geophysical measurements.  Loading tests on plates and piles.
00160421.name: Field Investigations in Soil Engineering

00160503.about: Corrosion processes of cementitious materials, polymeric materials and metals, and their dependence on environmental conditions.  Corrosion of steel in concrete.  Design considerations to prevent durability problems.  Protection of buildings and repair of corrosion damages.
00160503.name: Durability of Building Materials and Structures

00160504.about: The course deals with the various aspects of quality assurance and quality control on building sites and in plants. Included in thesyllabus: basic concept of q. Control and assurance, mathematical tools for the q. Control and practical methods for application ofq. Control. Particular problems of q. Assurance and q. Control in: design, building sites, infrastructure, precast concrete plants and plants producing components and materials for the building industry.
00160504.name: Quality Control and Assurance in Buildings

00160505.about: Timber, its structure and its mechanical and physical properties (Appearance, density, moisture content, swelling and shrinkage, strength and failure modes, strains). Relations between structure and properties. Classification of timber. Timber, plywood and wood products production. Timber connections. Composite timber components. Deterioration, durability and protection of timber. Structural design principles. Timber structures.
00160505.name: Construction with Timber Materials and Technology

00160619.about: INTRODUCTION TO FORMWORK. CLASSIFICATION, CONSTRUCTION AND ECONOMIC ASPECTS, ROLE OF THE PROJECT ENGINEER, PRINCIPLES OF FORMWORK DESIGN, PERMISSIBLE STRESSES, LIMIT STATE DESIGN OF FORMWORK, STANDARDIZATION ON FORMWORK, VERTICAL AND HORIZONTAL LOADS, STATIC AND ECONOIC CALCULATION, WORK INPUTS, SAFETY, DESIGN OF SLAB FORMWORK, DESIGN OF WALL.COLUMMN FORMWORK, DESIGN OF FORMWORK BASED ON MULTITIER SHORING TOWERS, MODULAR FORMS, INDUSTRIALIZED FORMING SYSTEMS, SPECIAL FORMING SYSTEMS, FORMS FOR BRDIGES, FORMS FOR TUNNELS.
00160619.name: Design of Formwork for Concrete

00160630.about: real estate markets dynamics - space (rent determination), assets (valuation), and development industry (construction of new projects). urban economics introductory models introduction to the underlying principles of different real estate market sectors (commercial, hospitality, retail, and logistics) with a focus on housing market analysis. real estate investments financing and taxation considerations. writing an investment project business plan followed by various sensitivity analyses. learning outcomes: at the end of the course the student will be able: 1. to analyze real estate makets supply and demand systems 2. to understand the mechanics of the urban land market usage in cities. 3. to understand financing and taxation considerations while analyzing real estate market investments 4. to write up a real-estate investment project business plan
00160630.name: Introduction to Real Estate Investment Analysis

00160631.about:
analysis of the objectives, risks and opportunities facing a cross- border real-estate entrepreneur. acquisition of reliable data and methodological real-estate market supply and demand analysis, while enhancing the geographical focus (continent, country, city and quarter). consideration of legal, tax and organizational aspects. project business plan configuration through sensitivity analysismethods. 
learning ouctomes: at the end of the course the student will be able: 
 1. to analyze the objectives, risks nad apportunities of real-estate cross-border entrepreneurship projects.
 2. to effectively and critically acquire data on glkobal real-estate mar kets. 
 3. to understand the required legal, tax and orgaizational set-up of the real-estate entrepreneurship at the target market.
 4. to prepare a real-estate entrepreneurship project business plant.
00160631.name: Cross-Border Real-Esate Entrepreneurship

00160709.about: topics: aspects of urban planning. transportation systems and their mutual influence on city.regional planning. the influence of planning on daily activity patterns. the integrated national master plan of building, development and conservation (nop 35). the national road master plan (3) and national rail master plan (23). transportation aspects of different regional and local plans. parking standards.
00160709.name: The Urban, Regional and National Planning and the Transportation Impact

00160712.about: the course covers basic concepts governing the design and performance of jointed plain concrete pavements. study topics include: overview of the construction process, slab on grade mechanics, young and aged concrete properties, arrangement and design of joints, typical distress modes and design basics and procedures.
00160712.name: Concrete Pavements

00160713.about: the general problem in optimal control theory. krotov's lemma and the bellman-krotov sufficient conditions. pontryagin's maximum principle boundary constraints and the transversality conditions. sliding modes and solutions. singular solutions. optimal control forisolated signalized intersections. optimal perimeter control for urban road networks. learning outcomes: at the end of the course the student will: 1. know how to formulate optimal control problems in transportation and other fields. 2. will have acquired sufficient conditions to find numerically optimal solutions. 3. know how to design optimal control for isolated signalized intersections. 4.  know how to solve the optimal perimeter control problem for large-scale transportation networks.
00160713.name: Optimal Control - Theory and Transportation Applications

00160801.about: Additions to adjustment by conditions without unknowns. Adjustment by parameter and stochastic constriants. A unified approach to least- squares adjustment. Adjustment of empirical functions using orthogonal and trigonometric polynomials. Datum parameters. Hypothesis tests.
00160801.name: Adjustment Computation 2

00160815.about: Using digital imagery for the preparation of digital orthophoto and mosaic maps.  The human visual system and its implications on photogrammetric processes. Using filters for edge and "interesting points" detection.  The scale-space principle.  Digital image matching: gray-level correlation, feature matching, symbolic matching. Geometric constraints and matching strategies.
00160815.name: Digital Photogrammetry

00160818.about: cadastre in the world, town planning and expropriation, land settlement implementation procedures, rural settlements, town planningfor equi-re-parcelization, introduction to analytical and three-dimensional cadastre
00160818.name: Aspects of Modern Cadastre

00160819.about: theory of marine surveying, international marine surveying standard. a multi-beam surveying system, introduction to commercial dataprocessing program.
00160819.name: Advanced Marine Surveying

00160820.about: radar and thermal remote sensing, spectral unmixing methods, data fusion in environmental remote sensing, spectral properties of soils, water and vegetation. remote sensing of mediterranean environments.
00160820.name: Remote Sensing for Environmental Mapping

00160826.about: introduction to geodesy (the shape of the earth, geodetic coordinate systems, higher geodesy and surveying). basic issues in the theory of errors, geodetic information sources - terastrial measurements, aerial photographs, satellites (gps) and remote sensing, horizontal vertical and 3d control, planimentric andtopographic mapping (gis), geodetic surveying equipment, calculation of areas and volumes, 1929 ordenance survey and 1998 surveying regulations.
00160826.name: Mapping and Surveying

00160828.about: the various principles required for a real-estate appraisal and specific real-estate appraisal problems. topics: measurement units in real-estate appraising, value principles, value components analysis, value types analysis, writing a real-estate appraisal report, residential , commercial and rural property appraising, the appraisal principles of real-estate,bundle of rights, issues in valuing public interest properties and approaches to their valuation appraisal of "special-use" property - definition, characteristic, principle and approaches.
00160828.name: Principles of Real-Estate Appraising

00160829.about: real-estate appraising through case studies: rural rezoning, the betterment levy, compensation for injuries to land, loan security appraisal, lessee.lessor rights valuation, public expropriation compensation, rezoning and subdivision according to the planning andbuilding law, appraisal of "special-use" property and development locationproperty, "combination" contracts for development in exchange forland, appraisal of rent-control property, appraisal of israel land administration owned property.
00160829.name: A Real-Estate Appraising Workshop

00160830.about: three-dimensional graphical models. 3d data representation and hierarchical models with application to geospatial data. generalization of 3d data and multi-resolution representation. photorealistic rendering. integration of image processing and graphical model. development in directx and opengl.
00160830.name: Three Dimensional Graphic Mapping

00160831.about: spatial data mining, gis online, single-objective and multi-objective decision making, mathematical and imaging models, cellular automation, multi-agent of models.
00160831.name: Computation and Quantitative Geoinformatics

00160832.about: Coordinate systems. transformation between coordinate systems. Navigation systems. gyroscopes and acceleration meters. Inertial navigation systems: error sources, initialization and calibration. inertial navigation systems combined with GPS.
00160832.name: Navigation and Inertial Systems

00160833.about: geographic information systems as a basis for location based services, design of location based application. architecture of mapping and location based application on the world wide web. the clinet side of a geographic based application, the server side of a geographic based application.
00160833.name: Location Based Services
