INTRODUCTION TO NUCLEAR MAGNETIC RESONANCE (NMR) AND TO NMR EQUIPMENT - CLASSICAL DESCRIPTION. NMR HAMILTONIAN AND THE HAMILTONIAN FOR SUPERCONDUCTORS FOR A SINGLE QUBIT AND FOR TWO QUBITS. THE DENSITY MATRIX AND THE PSEUDO-PURE STATE. SPIN ECHO AND RE-FOCUSING. MEASUREMENTS OF RELAXATION TIMES, T1 AND T2. QUANTUM GATES FOR QUANTUM COMPUTING IN NMR AND IN SUPERCONDUCTORS. PRODUCT OPERATOR FORMALISM. TRANSLATING QUANTUM ALGORITHMS INTO ELECTROMAGNETIC PULSE  SEQUENCES. BECOME FAMILIAR WITH THE SIMULATORS AND THE LABS (WITHOUT LAB WORK). DESIGNING EXPERIMENTS IN NMR AND SUPERCONDUCTORS, IMPLEMENTATION ON SIMULATORS, IMPLEMENTATION IN SUPERCONDUCTORS (VIA  IBM WEBSITE) ON THE IBM QUANTUM COMPUTER. CONDUCT AN ANALYSIS OF THE RESULTS. LEARNING OUTCOMES: BY THE END OF THE COURSE THE STUDENT WILL:
 1. UNDERSTAND HOW QUANTUM COMPUTATION IS IMPLEMENTED (IN TWO DIFFERENT TECHNOLOGIES), INCLUDING THE RELATION BETWEEN A HAMILTONIANS (WHICH EXPRESSES THE EQUATIONS OF MOTION) AND LOGIC GATES.
 2. BE ACQUAINTED TO SIMULATORS FOR RUNNING QUANTUM ALGORITHMSIN TWO TECHNOLOGIES.
 3. DE-FACTO EXAMINING AN ACTUAL EXPERIMENT RUNNING ON A REMOTE (WEB BASED) IBM QUANTUM COMPUTER.
02360991.name: Project in Quantum Computing

02370267.about:
performance metrics and their relation to computer architectures, performance evaluation methods. control hazards and branch prediction. the dataflow principle and eliminating false dependencies. superscalar processors, out-of-order, vliw. the memory system and storage. memory technologies and their limitations, cache memories, cache hierarchy, cache coherence and consistency. virtual memory,fast address translation (tlb), extensions for virtual machines. hardware multithreading (smt, gpgpu). reconfigurable processors (fpga, cgra).
learning outcomes: at the end ofthe course, students will understand:
1. the computer's building blocks, how modern proce ssors work, and design methods.
2. processor and computer system performance metrics.
3. system-wide design considerations of computer systems.
4. interactions across components in processors and computer systems.
02370267.name: COMPUTER ARCHITECTURE

02370343.about:
Recursive and primitive recursive functions, turing machines. equivalence between several models, church's thesis, universal machine, undecidable problems, deterministic and nondeterministic machines, the class p and np-completeness, cook's theorem._
 learning outcomes: by the end of the course, the student will: 
 1. be familiar with models of computation, in particular the turing machine model.
 2. distinguish between decidable and undecidable problems. 
 3. Be familiar with the concept of efficient computation (in timeor memory), and be able to classify problems into those that can be solved efficiently or that are ~computationally hard~.
 4. under sand and apply the concept of reduction between problems.
02370343.name: THEORY OF COMPUTATION

02380125.about:
linear system of equations, gauss elimination, lu and cholesky decomposition, positive definite matrices, least squares and pseudo-inverse, weighted least-squares, tikhonov's regularisation, inner-products and normed-vector spaces, orthogonality, qr and its uses,eigenvalues and singular values, the svd decomposition and its uses, itrative methods for solving linear and least-squares problems, matrix induced norms, gershgorin's theorem, the power method, numerical instability and numerical erros, toeplitz and circulant matrices, convolution, the discrete fourier transform and the fft. learning outcomes: by the end of the course the studetns will be abl e to:
 1. use elementary decomposition methods in numerical linear algebra - lu, qr, and svd - according to their use and computational complexity. 2. build algorithms for the solution of linear systems of equations, least-squares problems, and identification of eigenvalues and eigenvectors, by choosing the proper solvers based on the properties of the problems and their dimensions._
 3. prove convergence of iterative methods for solving numerical problems via eigen-analysis, operators' norms, and gershgorin's disk theorem. 4. compu
02380125.name: NUMERICAL ALGORITHMS M

02380739.about: Random sampling, static and dynamic randomized algorithms, computing convex hulls, linear programming, arrangements of line segments and davenport-schinzel sequences, voronoi diagrams with euclidean and non- euclidean metrics, probabilistic proofs.
02380739.name: Discrete Algorithmic Geometry

02380900.about: The seminar addresses updated issues in the theory of computation. Learning method is through supervised reading and presentaion ofrecent research papers chosen by the instructors.
02380900.name: Theory of Computation Research Seminar

02740026.about: Clinical criteria of musculo-skeletal diagnosis. Treatment of fractures, fracture disease, dislocations acute and chronic. Metabolic bone diseases. Congenital anomalies of the musculo-skeletal system. Inborn errors of metabolism. Reconstruction and replacement ofjoints.  Infections of bone and joints.  Pathologies of soft connective tissues. The hand. Reconstruction of tendons and hand function. Geriatric orthopaedics. Kinesiology and functional rehabilitation of the musculo-skeletal system.
02740026.name: Orthopedic Surgery (O.T)

02740109.about: Theoretical and practical basis for the recognition of situations requiring lifesaving first aid. Principles of basic resuscitationand basic practical skills in trauma care and resuscitation.
02740109.name: Introduction to Emergency Medicine

02740138.about: basic concepts in the analysis of signals and systems from the medical world. sampling, representation and analysis of data in timeand frequency spaces. structural programming: algorithmic approach to problem solving, variables, loops, control structures, input and output.
02740138.name: Medical Science: Analysis of Signals and Systems a'

02740142.about: the aim of this course is to introduce the students experientially into humane and clinical aspects of the professional world of the medical care. to acquire interpersonal and patient centered communication skills and reflective habits. the course alternate weekly between small groups instruction and discussions, and personal instruction and mentoring in clinical experiential setting at hospitals and primary care clinics.
02740142.name: Clinical Tuesday - Being a Doctor 1

02740143.about: the course aims to introduce the students into humane and clinical aspects of the professional world of the medical care. to acquire interpersonal and patient centered communication skills and reflective habits. students will encounter and discuss ethical dilemmas, and will learn basic physical examination and history taking. the course alternate weekly between small groups instruction and discussions, and personal instruction and mentoring in clinical experiential setting at hospitals and primary care clinics.
02740143.name: Clinical Tuesday - Being a Doctor 2

02740146.about: 1. EXPOSURE TO THE MEDICAL PROFESSION IN THE CLINICAL ENVIRONMENT 2. EXPOSURE TO VARIETY OF MEDICAL SPECIALTIES AS PART OF POTENTIAL FUTURE CAREERS 3. UNDERSTANDING INTERPROFESSIONAL TEAMWORK ROLE IN THE CLINICAL ENVIRONMENT 4. IMPROVING INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION SKILLS (LISTENING AND INTERVIEWING) 5. SMALL GROUP LEARNING EXPERIENCE, IMPROVING CONSTRUCTIVE FEEDBACK SKILLS
02740146.name: CCC:CLINIC! CAREER AND COMMUNICATION 2

02740148.about: 1) PEDIATRIC CARDIOLOGY AND NICU 2) EMERGENCY MEDICINE 3) DEVELOPMENTAL PEDIATRICS 4) CLINICAL GENETICS 5) PATHOLOGY 6) SURGICAL PROCEDURES 7) MUSIC THERAPY AND MAGIC IN MEDICINE/CLOWNING 8) REHABILITATION MEDICINE/PHYSIOTHERAPY
02740148.name: HORIZONS IN MEDICINE 2 ( TEAMS )

02740165.about: Mendelian inheritance, genotypes and phenotypes, lineages, human mendelian genetics, Hardy-Weinberg law, dominant and recessive traits, meiosis, the chromosonal theory of inheritance, linkage to sex chromosomes, deviations from mendelian genetics, interactions between genes, sex determination, dosage compensation, linkage, recombination and genetic mapping, genetic mapping in bacteria, chromosome structure, chromosomal aberrations, mutations, metabolic pathways and one gene-one enzyme theory.
02740165.name: General Genetics

02740166.about: Dynamical systems: constructing differential equations, graphical solutions in 1D, linearization in 2D, nullclines, eigenvalues. High dimentional analysis: supervised and unsupervised. K means. PCA
02740166.name: Quantitative Methods in Med. Sciences B

02740167.about: Two parts - Part A.basic cellular structure and function - organlles, membranes, nucleus, central dogma, protein synthesis and secretion, cell cycle. Part B. the cell and its environment- signal transduction, cell:cell interactions, ectracellular matrix, differention and cancer.
02740167.name: Cell Biology

02740178.about: This course is taught in English as part of the TEAMS program. The final grade is determined by the progress in the department, presentation ability, and oral exam. The clinical study period lasts 4 weeks. Each student is responsible for their patients, admittance of patients, tracking patiets, and a diagnotic summary. Stuents are expected to participate in all departmental activities (diagnostics, clinic, and neurophysiology).
02740178.name: Neurology (Teams)

02740182.about: descriptive statistics, statistical measures, normal distribution, central limit theorem, statistical significance, p-value, type iand type ii errors, confidence interval, parametric and non-parametric tests, linear regression, logistic regression, probability and bayes theorem, analysis of variance, repeated measures, survival analysis
02740182.name: Biostatistics

02740183.about: UPON COMPLETION OF THE COURSE THE STUDENT WILL HAVE A BASIC UNDERSTANDING OF THE APPROACH TO CLINICAL PROBLEMS-BEING ABLE TO IDENTIFY CLINICAL PROBLEMS, RESEARCH RELEVANT BASIC SCIENCE AND CLINICAL KNOWLEDGE AND SYNTHESIZE THAT KNOWLEDGE- AND DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF COMMON DISEASES AFFECTING MAJOR ORGAN SYSTEMS, AND BE ABLE TO IDENTIFY APPROPRIATE TREATMENTS (MEDICAL/SURGICAL/BEHAVIORAL).THE STUDENT WILL ALSO BECOME PROFICIENT AND KNOWLEDGEABLE IN STRATEGIES OF PREVENTIVE MEDICINE TO PREVENT THE ONSET OF SUCH DISEASES THROUGH THE USE OF THE PHYSICAL EXAMINATION AND HISTORY, SCREENING TESTS, BIOMARKERS, AND TARGETED AND POPULATION-LEVEL INTERVENTIO NS.
02740183.name: INTRO.TO CLINICAL MEDICINE (TEAMS)

02740219.about: Descriptive statistics: distribution and its characteristics. Probability, point and interval estimation. Morbidity rates. Inference: evaluation of new treatment and risk factors. Parametric and non-parametric significance tests. Data analysis of clinical and laboratory experiments. Interpretation of outputs, and use of computer-mediated statistical analysis.
02740219.name: Biostatistics

02740231.about: IN THIS COURSE, PRINCIPLES OF BIOMEDICAL DATA ANALYSIS WILL BE TAUGHT WITH AN EMPHASIS ON MOLECULAR BIG DATA (OMICS). UNDERSTANDINGOF MULTIDIMENSIONAL DATA PROPERTIES AND THE COMMON ALGORITHMS THAT CAN BE USED TO WORK WITH THEM. PRINCIPLES BEHIND MACHINE LEARNING. TEACHING WILL COMBINE LEARNING OF PRINCIPLES AND CRITICAL READING OF SCIENTIFIC PAPERS.
02740231.name: TRANSLATIONAL BIOINFORMATICS  GENOMICS

02740232.about: throughout the course we will be introduced to psychology as a science which studies human behavior. the participants will learn updated and traditional subjects associated with the field, research theories and specialization areas. a special emphasis will be puton psychology areas in which doctors are specialized. the main goal is to examine the recent developments of the empirical and theoretical areas and their implications on social and human behavior, as well as to use the relevant knowledge of psychology to analyzeand understand central issues the medicine deals with. the first semester will be devoted to studying human behavior.
02740232.name: Psychology and Sociology 1

02740234.about: the purpose of the course is to expose the student to the doctor's work performed in community clinics. the student will learn to be acquainted with, and to value the work and responsibility of the relatively lone doctor in the community clinic, in comparison with the relatively communal work in the framework of the hospital. during the course, five unique meeting dedicated to the studying and developing of communicative skills will be held with both patients and their families, and the medical staff. these meetings will be joined by guiding doctors from the field of community medicine, alongside the group's original counselors. interviews with patient s will be held, as will role playing. to conclude, discussions and feedback will take place under the counselors' guidance.
02740234.name: Being a Doctor-Exposure to the Medical P

02740235.about: the purpose of the course is to expose the student to the work of the doctor carried out in less ordinary places. the student will be exposed to the medical activity performed in prison, abused women's homes, challenged children's homes, drug supplying stations and so forth. in these visits, the student will discover the wide variety of needs in the society with which the doctor is entrusted and must give answer to. interviews with patients will be held as will discussions and feedback with local counselors and with the original counselors.
02740235.name: Being a Doctor-Exposure to the Medical P

02740237.about: Illustration of experimental approaches to subjects studied in clinical biochemistry.  The course includes experiments on hormonal regulation of carbohydrate and fat metabolism:  biochemical diagnosis of various chemopathological states.
02740237.name: Clinical Biochemistry Lab.

02740240.about: Integrative view on human morphology, from individual tissues to topographic and system level of the thorax, abdomen and pelvic. Ineach topic the histological, embryological and anatomical aspects will be detailed. Importantly, clinical relevance and imaging will be central. Dissection, embryology and histology labs are an integral part of the course.
02740240.name: Integrative View on Human Morphology

02740241.about: Proteins- amino acids peptides and proteins, structure and function, working with proteins (methods), proteomics, bioinformatics. Enzymes- enzyme kinetics, mechanism of action, Michaelis-Menten, inhibitors, allosteric enzymes. Carbohydrates- principles of bioenergetics and metabolism, glycolysis, gluconeogenesis, the citric acid cycle, oxidative phosphorylation. Lipids- pentose phosphate pathway, metabolism of fatty acids, triglycerides, phospholipids, cholesterol, lipoproteins.
02740241.name: General Biochemistry

02740242.about: The course will focus on molecular and medical aspects of human genetics. The following subjects will be discussed: the importance of genetics in medicine today, population genetics, genetic counseling and risk estimation, sex determination and disorders of sex development, methods for laboratory diagnostics in genetics, genetic basis of human diseases, mitochondrial diseases, diseases causedby dna repeats, genetics and cancer, prenatal genetic evaluation, ethical concerns in medical genetics.
02740242.name: Human Genetics

02740243.about: The course aim is to provide the basis of molecular biology and mechanisms of regulation of genetic information. The course focuseson understanding dna structure, chromatin, DNA replication, DNA repair, mechanism of control of gene expression, molecular biology methods and their application in biological research and medicine today.
02740243.name: Molecular Bio.and Regulatory Mechanisms

02740245.about: The course will cover the basic aspects of the biology of bacteria. Topics will include morphology and function of the bacterial cell, physiology, genetics, genomics, evolution and systematics of bacteria, inter-bacterial communication, bacteriophages, host-pathogen interactions, the microbiome, mechanisms of action of antibiotics and bacterial resistance mechanisms, sterilization methods.
02740245.name: General Bacteriology

02740246.about: The course will encompass the molecular biology of cancer from the single cell to the tissue and organism. Among the topics coveredare: biological characterization of cancer. Oncogenes and tumor suppressors. Growth factor and oncogenic signaling. Apoptosis, cancer genomics and genetic instability, angiogenesis and methasthasis, cancer therapoetics.
02740246.name: The Molecular Basis of Cancer

02740247.about: The course provides basic knowledge of the Biology of viruses and the diseases they cause. Subjects include: mechanisms of replication of DNA and RNA viruses, the interactions of and the virus with the host cell, virus-induced oncogenesis, pathogenesis of viral infections of the organism, diseases caused by human viruses, including clinical and the response epidemiological aspects, antiviral drugs.
02740247.name: Virology

02740249.about: Introduction, Antibodies: structure and function, classes, structure, genetics of specificity. Complement, antigen - antibody reactions, monoclonal Abs, B cells development, Cellular interactions, MHC and T cell activation, Innate immune system, Cytokine regulation of innate and adaptive immunity, Inflammation, adhesion molecules and chemokines, immunological tolerance and autoimmunity, Immune Complex Diseases, T and B cell mediated autoimmunity.
02740249.name: Basic Immunology

02740250.about: Understanding developmental biology requires an integration of the fields of cell biology, molecular biology and genetics. The course will cover: basic concepts of developmental biology, early embryonic development, tissue regeneration, comparisons in evolution and development between different species, teratology developmental defects and their causes.
02740250.name: Developmental Biology

02740251.about: Introduction to population genetics. The main evolutionary forces: mutation, natural selection, genetic drift and other stochastic forces. The genetic code and codon bias. Phylogenetics. Evolution of gene regulation. Genome evolution. "Medical" evolution: cancer evolution, evolution of genetic diseases. evolution of antibiotic resistance, pathogen evolution.
02740251.name: Evolution

02740252.about: The course will cover the basic biology, genetics and pathogenesis of parasites (helminthes and protozoa) and pathogenic fungi (yeasts and molds). For each pathogen or class of pathogens, life cycles, virulence, transmission, diagnosis and treatments will be discussed.
02740252.name: Eukaryotic Microbial Pathogens

02740253.about: Flux and transport in biological membranes, biopotentials, electrochemical equilibrium. ionic channels, transportes, kinetics, action potential,electrical synapses,chemical synapses, cellular motion, muscle contraction.
02740253.name: Cellular Physiology

02740254.about: The course discusses the anatomy of the head, neck and the upper and lower limbs. It will be given as classroom lectures, cadaver dissection labs, cross-cut specimen exercises and computerized virtual dissection labs. The course will thoroughly discuss head and neck embryology, the anatomy of the skeletal structure, soft tissue anatomy and the anatomy of the nervous system, vascular system and vital organs of the head, neck and upper and lower limbs. Student grade will be based on a written exam and cadaver dissection labexam.
02740254.name: Anatomy of the Head, Neck and Limbs

02740255.about: the clinical experience will take place mainly at the community. learning and implementing life style medicine in the students' life as well as with patients with chronic illness using motivational interview. the students will meet and communicate with diverse populations with special needs.
02740255.name: Clinical Tuesday - Being a Doctor 3

02740256.about: the clinical experience will take place mainly at the community. the students will meet diverse populations with special needs. (domestic violence, addictions, prisoners, children with special needs etc.) improve their communication skills and learn how to use them in more complicated situations (asking about domestic violence, addictions etc.). the students will practice motivational interview and coaching to help chronic ill patients make life style changes.
02740256.name: Clinical Tuesday - Being a Doctor 4

02740257.about: the course provides an introduction to clinical anatomy, and a comprehensive description of the human head and neck, and upper limb: the skeletal framework, viscera, innervation, blood supply, and venous and lymphatic drainage. in addition, the course systematically teaches the radiologic anatomy and the anatomical basis of the physical examination of these regions.
02740257.name: ANATOMY A

02740258.about: introduction: the place of psychological thinking in the medical world, the biopsychosocial model, patient-doctor relationship in different contexts, types of psychopathologies encountered in hospital medical wards, a model for analyzing highly charged emotional interactions, physical and psychic pain. theories dealing with health promotion and preventive medicine.
02740258.name: Psychology in the Medical World

02740259.about: the course provides an introduction to clinical anatomy, and a comprehensive description of the human head and neck, and upper limb: the skeletal framework, viscera, innervation, blood supply, and venous and lymphatic drainage. in addition, the course teaches theradiologic anatomy and physical examination of these regions.
02740259.name: Anatomy a

02740260.about: basic introduction to histology, applications and limitation of the approach, study of the structure of systems and tissues in the human body and their identification by histology. frontal lectures will be followed by lab exercise in which students will practice the observation and analysis of histological tissue sections.
02740260.name: Histology

02740261.about: introduction. antibodies: structure and function, classes, structure, genetics of specificity. complement, antigen - antibody reactions, monoclonal abs, b cells development, cellular interactions, mhc and t cell activation, innate immune system, inflammation, adhesion molecules and chemokines, immunological tolerance and autoimmunity, selected clinical conditions such as allergy, immune deficiency, transplantation and responsiveness to infections.
02740261.name: Basic and Clinical Immunology

02740262.about: the first part of the course covers basic concepts in developmental biology, including cell differentiation, morphogenesis, formation of the body plan, and regeneration.  the second part of the course covers human embryology, from fertilization through organ formation.
02740262.name: Basic and Medical Embryology

02740263.about: the course provides a comprehensive description of the human thorax, abdomen, pelvis, and lower limb: the skeletal framework, viscera, innervation, blood supply, and venous and lymphatic drainage. in addition, the course teaches the radiologic anatomy and physical examination of these regions.
02740263.name: Anatomy B

02740265.about: the course includes two parts. introduction to basic research: molecular tools used in biological lab work, scientific reasoning and experimental design. clinical research: initial design of a clinical research question, database searches and selecting appropriate research methods. exposure to studies performed at the faculty of medicine.
02740265.name: EXPERIENCING BASIC AND CLINICAL RESEARCH

02740266.about: the course provides a comprehensive description of the human thorax, abdomen, pelvis, and lower limb: the skeletal framework, viscera, innervation, blood supply, and venous and lymphatic drainage. in addition, the course systematically teaches the radiologic anatomy and the anatomical basis of the physical examination of these regions.
02740266.name: ANATOMY B

02740268.about: COURSE TOPICS: HORMONAL CONTROL OF METABOLISM! DIABETES! SELECTED HEREDITARY DISEASES SUCH AS GLYCOGEN STORAGE DISEASES. PLASMA LIPOPROTEINS! LIVER FUNCTION DISORDERS! AMINO ACID METABOLISM AND THE ROLES OF THE LIVER IN METABOLISM. DIAGNOSTIC ENZYMOLOGY AND BLOODPROTEINS! VITAMINS! THE MOLECULAR BASIS OF HEREDITARY DISEASES THAT DAMAGE HEMOGLOBIN AND SPHINGOLIPID METABOLISM.
02740268.name: CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY

02740270.about: INTRODUCTION TO THE CLINIC IS AN INTENSE, 6-WEEK COURSE WHICH TEACHES STRUCTURED CLINICAL COMMUNICATION AND A COMPREHENSIVE PHYSICAL EXAMINATION. ELEMENTS OF THE COMPLETE PATIENT INTERVIEW ARE INTRODUCED IN AN INCREMENTAL FASHION, WITH EMPHASIS ON ROLE-PLAYING AND STUDENT COMPOSITION. IN ADDITION, A COMPREHENSIVE, ALL-ORGAN SYSTEM (EXCEPT GENITAL) PHYSICAL EXAMINATION IS TAUGHT USING A COMBINATION OF DIDACTIC PRESENTATION, STANDARDIZED PATIENT DRILL AND IN-HOSPITAL BEDSIDE APPLICATION. THE PATHOPHYSIOLOGIC FUNDAMENTALS UNDERPINNING THE PHYSICAL EXAMINATION ARE EMPHASIZED.
02740270.name: INTRODUCTION TO THE CLINIC (TEAMS)

02740271.about: THE PATHOLOGY COURSE IS DIVIDED INTO TWO PARTS.  PART I, GENERAL PATHOLOGY, REFERS TO THE STUDY OF BASIC PATHOLOGY PROCESSES THAT UNDERLIE ALL DISEASE SUCH AS CELLULAR PATHOLOGY, INFLAMMATION AND REPAIR, FLUID AND HEMODYNAMIC DERANGEMENTS, NEOPLASIA, AND THE STUDY OF GENETIC, IMMUNOLOGIC, METABOLIC AND DEFICIENCY, INFECTIONS, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND PEDIATRIC DISEASES.  PART II, SYSTEMS PATHOLOGY,REFERS TO THE STUDY OF DISEASES AFFECTING SPECIFIC ORGANS AND THEIR SYSTEMS SUCH AS CARDIOVASCULAR, RESPIRATORY, ALIMENTARY TRACT, LYMPHOID AND HEMOPOIETIC TISSUES, LIVER, PANCREAS AND BILIARY TRACT, ENDOCRINE, URINARY, MALE AND FEMALE GENITAL, NERVOUS SYSTEM, MUS CULOSKELETAL, AND INTEGUMENT.
02740271.name: PATHOLOGY ( TEAMS )

02740318.about: The definition of epidemiology, causelity, methodology. Measures of disease frequency and associations. Principles of infections diseases epidemiology. The epidemiology of heart diseases, injuries, cancer and health services evaluation will be discussed.
02740318.name: Epidemiology

02740319.about: the course will include: replication cycle of dna and rna viruses, antiviral drugs, virus-host interaction, virus pathogenesis and host responses. the course will also include clinical and epidemiological aspects of viral infection.
02740319.name: VIROLOGY

02740320.about: This course will examine the moral and legal aspects of the profession of medicine and the moral principles guiding the contemporary physician. The following topics, among others, will be examined: ethical theory, autonomy and paternalism, and informed consent.
02740320.name: Medical Ethics and Law

02740323.about: Introduction to hemodynamics - myocardium - mechanical and electrical activity, neural and hormonal control, heart sounds, coronarycirculation. Peripheral vascular circulation - neural and hormonal control, arterial blood pressure, myocardial electrophysiology. Autonomous transmitters and K+ and Ca++ ions - influence on myocardial electrical activity. Respinatory mechanics, gas exchange in the lungs, CO2 blood transport, respiratory control.
02740323.name: Physiology 1 - Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Physiology

02740326.about: The purpose of the course is to gain insights into and become familiar with the influence that society and culture have on health, sickness, the doctor and medicine. The student will examine his own cultural and social biases. Will develop awareness of the influence of society and culture on illness, disease and physician patient relationship, the student will be exposed to and reveal personal and professional ethical dilemmas in the social-cultural context, will identify the social and cultural influences on the approachand perceptions in the physician's work and the medical world, will be introduced to different sectors of treatment and their intera ction with the doctor's work. methods: meetings with doctors, caregivers and patients, meeting in a hiv clinic, familiarization with alternative medicine, a visit to a holocaust museum (holocaust and medicine), issues regarding breaking bad news and organs donation, exposure to palliative medicine and ethical questions which are raised regarding patients who terminally ill and more. The student will be evaluated by: the participation in the course and its meetings, a presentation or a paper on one of the issues that were studied in th
02740326.name: Being a Doctor-Cultural and Ethical Issues in Medicine 5

02740327.about: The purpose of the course is to gain insights into and become familiar with the influence that society and culture have on health, sickness, the doctor and medicine. The student will examine his own cultural and social biases. will develop awareness of the influence of society and culture on illness, disease and physician patient relationship, the student will be exposed to and reveal personal and professional ethical dilemmas in the social-cultural context, will identify the social and cultural influences on the approachand perceptions in the physician's work and the medical world, will be introduced to different sectors of treatment and their intera ction with the doctor's work. methods: meetings with doctors, caregivers and patients, meeting in a hiv clinic, familiarization with alternative medicine, a visit to a holocaust museum (holocaust and medicine), issues regarding breaking bad news and organs donation, exposure to palliative medicine and ethical questions which are raised regarding patients who are terminally ill and more. The student will be evaluated by: the participation in the course and its meetings, a presentation or a paper on one of the issues that were studied i
02740327.name: Being a Doctor-Cultural and Ethical Issues in Medicine 6

02740328.about: Principles of the endocrine system. genome. Feedback mechanisms, densitization. Effects and regulation of production of hormones ofthe hypothalamus and the anterior and posterior pituitary, hormones of the adrenal (cortex and medulla), thyroid, and pancreas. Calcium-regulating hormones: prostanoids, endocrinology of male and female reproduction. Examples of endocrine disorders.
02740328.name: Endocrinology Physiology and Patohphysiology

02740336.about: Sensory systems including visual, auditory, somatosensory, chemical senses, vestibular and pain. Motor systems including spinal cord and CNS level, cerebellum and basal ganglia. Learning and memory systems, emotions and cognition.
02740336.name: Systems Neurophysiology

02740338.about: Organization principles, spinal cord, organization of sensory and motor systems, brainstem and cranial nerves, diencephalon, motor system, basal ganglia and cerebellum, cerebrum and cerebral cortex, CSF, meninges, cerebral blood supply and drainage. Pregnant women will execute the dissection portion of course the following year upon completion of their 4 year Bsc degree.
02740338.name: Neuroanatomy

02740339.about: The important groups of medically relevant bacteria. For each species or group of species, mechanisms of infection and of virulence, diagnostic methods, and treatments will be discussed. Molecular methods of detection and monitoring of pathogenic microbes. The laboratory exercises will enable familiarization with pathogenic microbes and with diagnostic laboratory methods.
02740339.name: Medical Bacteriology

02740348.about: Renal excretion, control of renal processes, acid-base and body electrolyte balance, digestive system function. Quantitative monitoring of physiological parameters in experimental animals and humans. Control mechanisms of circulation, hemorrhage and shock, respirometry, control mechanisms of gas exchange, regulation of water and electrolyte balance, experimental approach to effects of the CNSand autonomic nervous system, recording and analysis of biopotentials, e.g. electrocardiogram.
02740348.name: Physiology 2 - Regulatory Physiology

02740352.about: The aim is to provide basic knowledge in clinical nutrition, recognize the importance of nutrition in human health and the significance of nutrition planning in the medical treatment in health and disease. major topics include nutrients and metabolism, nutrition evaluation, infant nutrition, malnutrition, obesity, atherosclerosis and nutrition support (enteral, parenteral).
02740352.name: Introduction to Clinical Nutrition

02740353.about: The course will include the following topics: multivariate linear regression, logistic regression, analysis of variance and multiple comparisons, survival analysis and key tests in non-parametric statistics. Emphasis will be placed on analyzing medical research. Use of statistical software will be incorporated.
02740353.name: Advanced Topics in Biostatistics

02740361.about: the course provides a comprehensive description of the human central and peripheral nervous system: the embryonic development, the structure of brain vesicles and their connection, structure of the peripheral nerve, arterial supply and venous drainage. the coursedescribes the radiologic anatomy of the brain and the basic neurologic examination.
02740361.name: Neuroanatomy

02740362.about: Topics studied in this course will include major clinical aspects of the immune system that will be based on early studies of basicimmunology course. Selected clinical topics in immunology will be studied as well as immunological mechanisms, symptoms and therapy. The course will discuss autoimmune diseases that are mediated by B and T lymphocytes, allergies and hypersensitivity reactions, immunedeficiencies, immunobiology of transplantation and responsiveness to infections.
02740362.name: Clinical Immunology

02740367.about: The objectives of the course are to teach the fundamentals of Pharmacology, including pharmacodynamics, pharmacokinetics, drugs that modulate the autonomic and somatic nervous systems as well as central nerous system, drugs that affect the cardiovascular system, drugs to manage pain and inflammation and drugs that promote local and central anesthesia.
02740367.name: Basic Pharmacology

02740368.about: The course deals with the causes of various disease, the mechanisms of pathological states and the eequence of events of the diseases. The course includes the details of hemodynamic, infectious, degenerative, genetic, environmental, pediatric and malignant diseases. In addition there are lectures dealing with the cytological diagnosis of malignant and benign tumors, immunological diseases andAIDS.
02740368.name: General Pathology

02740369.about: Erythropoiesis, deficiencies and hemoglobinopathies, chronic inflammation and anemia, inherited bone marrow failure, acquired clonal disorders, hematopoietic stem cells, the development of cancer in myeloid and lymphoid cells, thrombocytes regulstion and disorders, transfusions, transfusion reactions, hazards and complications, coagulation, inherited and acquired coagulopathies, blood coagulation inhibitors.
02740369.name: Hematology,from Science to Practice

02740370.about: this course is aimed at building cultural competence as well as inter-professional communication skills and team work. the studentswill meet populations from diverse cultural and social backgrounds and participate in planning and building an intervention programs to improve health outcomes. the students will study and work in small groups in primary care communities, hospitals and with special populations.
02740370.name: Clinical Tuesday - Being a Doctor 5

02740371.about: this course is aimed at building cultural competence as well as inter-professional communication skills and team work. the studentswill meet populations from diverse cultural and social backgrounds and participate in planning and building an intervention programs to improve health outcomes. the students will study and work in small groups in primary care communities, hospitals and with special populations. ethical dilemmas will be discussed from historical, social and contemporary clinical experience. this course continues course a clinical humane experience 5.
02740371.name: Clinical Tuesday - Being a Doctor 6

02740372.about: prokaryotic cellular structure and function, physiology, genetics, genomics, evolution and systematics of bacteria, bacterial communication, microbiota and host-pathogen interactions, the major groups of pathogenic bacteria and their characteristics, including infection and virulence mechanisms, treatments. the laboratory will illustrate identification and tracking of bacterial pathogens and their sensitivity to antibiotics.
02740372.name: Bacteriology

02740374.about: during the course, the student will study in small groups the following topics: history taking components and guided history taking, general evaluation and vital signs, physical examination of the respiratory, cardiovascular and the gastrointestinal systems
02740374.name: INT. TO CLINICAL MEDICINE 2

02740375.about: the course provides a comprehensive description of the human central and peripheral nervous system: the embryonic development, the structure of brain vesicles and their connection, structure of the peripheral nerve, arterial supply and venous drainage. in addition, the course systematically describes the radiologic anatomy of the brain and the anatomical basis of the neurologic examination.
02740375.name: NEUROANATOMY

02740400.about: THE COURSE IS BASED ON INTEGRATING THE PRECLINICAL AND CLINICAL MANIFESTATIONS OF BODY SYSTEMS, FOCUSING ON ANATOMY, PHYSIOLOGY ANDPATHOLOGY. THE COURSE WILL BEGIN WITH INTRODUCTIONS TO EKG, IMAGING, NUCLEAR MEDICINE AND LABORATORY MEDICINE. THREE EXAMINATIONS WILL BE HELD. THE PASSING GRADE IS 65 FOR EACH OF THE 3 EXAMINATIONS, AS WELL AS 65 SEPARATELY FOR PATHOLOGY. , 20 WEEKS COURSE.
02740400.name: Preclinical-Clinical Integrated Systems

02740402.about: introduction of the basic principles of how to approach a patient. amongst these are communication skills, knowledge and integration skills. these will be applied as the basics of anamnesis and physical examination in the clinical setting. the course booklet is obligatory and the textbook is "bates' guide to physical examination and history-taking".
02740402.name: Introduction to Clinical Medicine

02740443.about: the capsule is held in small groups, led by physicians that serve as mentors during the 3 clinical years. its primary goal: strengthening professional identity of medical student by sharing experiences from the clinical rotations, reflecting on ethical dilemmas, and giving and receiving feedback from their peers.
02740443.name: The Capsule - 1

02740520.about: THE AIM OF THE COURSE IS TO EXPOSE THE STUDENT TO THE WORLD OF IMAGING, INCLUDING FAMILIARITY WITH THE VARIETY OF DIAGNOSTIC AND THERAPEUTIC PROCEDURES OFFERED IN THE IMAGING DEPARTMENT, THE ADVANTAGES AND DISADVANTAGES OF THE VARIOUS IMAGING TOOLS, AND THE PRINCIPLES FOR AN EDUCATED CHOICE OF THE APPROPRIATE IMAGING TOOL RELEVANT TO THE CLINICAL QUESTION. EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON IMPARTING BASIC SKILLS AND FAMILIARITY WITH BASIC CONCEPTS IN REGARDS TO CHEST X-RAYS, INCLUDING IDENTIFICATION OF NORMAL ANATOMY AND MAIN PATHOLOGIES, WHILE INTEGRATING PERSONAL AND FRONTAL LEARNING, INTERACTIVE EXERCISES AND PRESENTING CASE STUDIES.
02740520.name: Diagnostic Radiology

02740539.about: THE CURRICULUM AIMS TO PROVIDE THE STUDENT WITH A UNIQUE MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH TO THE ORTHOPEDIC PATIENT THROUGH AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROCESS OF POST TRAUMATIC STATUS AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF "THE DEBILITATED" SYNDROMES. THE ROTATION IN ORTHOPEDIC WILL INSTILL IN THE STUDENT A CLINICAL APPROACH TO THE ORTHOPEDIC PATIENT IN VARIOUS CLINICAL SETTINGS, INCLUDING COMMUNITY, ACUTE CARE, REHABILITATION AND INSTITUTIONS. THE STUDENT WILL BE ACTIVE IN CLERKING AND PRESENTING PATIENTS, PARTICIPATING IN CLINICAL DISCUSSIONS,OUTPATIENT CLINICS OPERATING THEATRE AND PRESENTING SEMINARS.
02740539.name: Orthopedic Surgery

02740544.about: THE TRAINING (CLERKSHIP) WILL IMPART KNOWLEDGE AND CLINICAL SKILLS IN THE FIELD OF CARDIOLOGY AS REQUIRED FOR A STUDENT AS PART OF HIS TRAINING IN THE MEDICAL SCHOOL.
02740544.name: Clinical Cardiology

02740725.about: The aim of the test is to examine the ability of the student to identify, diagnose and treat psychiatric disorders, (and to) recognize the unique ethical and legal aspects of the field. The student is expected to recognize and to offer the patient emotional support and treatment (that is) within the capabilities of every physician to provide and to idebtify cases that require referral to a psychiatrist.
02740725.name: Final Examination in Psychiatry

02750109.about: as part of the course, students will take part in activities of the ~new spirit clinic~ that based on (voluntary) treatment provided by senior doctors, where a combination of a medical education process is held side by side with providing treatment to unrecognized populations.
02750109.name: CLINIC FOR STATUSLESS 1

02750110.about: as part of the course, students will take part in activities of the ~new spirit clinic~ that based on (voluntary) treatment provided by senior doctors, where a combination of a medical education process is held side by side with providing treatment to unrecognized populations.
02750110.name: CLINIC FOR STATUSLESS 2

02750111.about: the course will examine different subject in medicine, psychology and sociology in and through the cinema. for example: loss and bereavement, mental health, patient-doctor relationship, gender issues. the course includes lectures and guided film viewing and in the end the student will present a subject that he will choose.
02750111.name: MEDICINE THROUGH THE CAMERA LENS

02750112.about: the course introduces the main themes of human evolution, along 6 million years since our last common ancestor with the apes. hominin fossils will be presented as evidence of the evolutionary process both on the clade  leading to  h. sapiens and on  side-branches from anatomical, functional, genetic, and archaeological perspectives.
02750112.name: HUMAN EVOLUTION

02750200.about: 1. The history of medicine in the world. Medicine in prehistory, ancient civilization, the Middle Ages, and the Renaissance. The development of microbiology, surgery, pharmacology and nursing. The Red Cross and other humanitarian organizations. The Jewish contribution to medicine. 2. The history of medicine in Eretz Yisrael. Folk medicine. Napoleon's physicians in the Holy Land. History of medicine in Jerusalem, Galilee, Haifa, Zichron Yaakov, Jaffa, Tel Aviv, and the South. The contribution of the Rothschilds to the development of medicine in Eretz Yisrael. The story of Hadassah and the Sick Funds. The beginning of Magen David Adom. The aliyah of the Jewish physicians from Germany. Medicine during the struggle for the establishment of the State of Israel.
02750200.name: History of Medicine

02750208.about: The course will cover the following subjects: 1. identification of emergency situations and applying first aid. 2. cardio pulmonaryresuscitation using bag mask valve, oxygen and automated external defibrillator. 3. life threatening situations-myocardial infarct,pulmonary edema, seizures, diabetic emergencies, cva. 4. trauma-kinematics and injury mechanisms in trauma, head, thorax and abdominal injuries. treatment of external bleeding, insertion of iv catheter. 5. multi casualty scenarios.
02750208.name: Introduction in Emergency Medicine 2

02750209.about: 1. Overview on cardio pulmonary resuscitation in adults and children. 2. Focused history taking and treatment priorities. 3. Pre-hospital treatment of traumatic emergencies. 4. Environmental emergencies. 5. Toxicological multi-casualty scenarios. 6. Gynecologicalemergencies. 7. Legal aspects.
02750209.name: Introduction to Emergency Medicine 3

02750213.about: the students will learn about the hallmarks of cancer from a clinical perspective. every lesson will present a patient, discuss his/her therapy, and learn which hallmark of cancer is targeted in this patient. our goal is that students in the preclinical years will be presented with real life clinical cases, and see the theoretical principles of cancer come to life in clinical care.
02750213.name: HALLMARK OF CANCER - GENOME TO THERAPY

02750214.about: INTRODUCTION! FINANCING OF THE HEALTH SYSTEM! DEMAND FOR HEALTH SERVICES! THE HEALTH INSURANCE MARKET! MANAGED CARE - MCO INEQUALITY IN HEALTH SYSTEM! REGULATION AND INEFFECTIVENESS IN HEALTH SYSTEM! REGULATIONS FOR RISK- CAPITATION FORMULA! GOVERNMENT INTERVENTION! THE DOCTOR AND THE DOCTOR'S FIRM! HOSPITALS IN ISRAEL! DIGITAL MEDICINE - ECONOMIC ASPECTS.
02750214.name: HEALTH ECONOMICS

02750215.about: INTRODUCTION TO THE CONCEPT OF DEATH! CHARACTERISTICS AND DEFINITIONS. UNDERSTANDING THE DIFFERENCES IN THE PERCEPTION OF DEATH ANDMOURNING IN THE CIRCLE OF LIFE AND IN DIFFERENT SOCIETIES! IN THE ACCEPTED THEORIES! KNOWING THE LAW AND FORMULATING A PERSONAL POSITION TOWARDS MORAL DILEMMAS RELATED TO DEATH - EUTHANASIA! PALLIATION! GIVING A DIAGNOSIS AND CHANCES OF RECOVERY! GIVING OR NOT GIVING TREATMENT! ENCOURAGING HOPE. DEALING WITH PERSONAL AND CULTURAL BARRIERS TOWARDS THE ISSUE OF DEATH.
02750215.name: A MATTER OF MEDICINE AND DEATH

02750216.about: - GUIDANCE ON MD THESES - TIME MANAGEMENT - SEARCH ENGINES - TYPES OF STUDIES - AUTHOR ORDER! REFERENCE MANAGEMENT - BASIC RESEARCH- RESEARCH DESIGN - DESCRIPTIVE STATISTICS + PRACTICE - INFERENTIAL STATISTICS - SCIENTIFIC WRITING - MANUSCRIPT SUBMISSION! IMPACTFACTORS - CRITICAL READING - THE ART OF PRESENTATION
02750216.name: RESEARCH AND SCIENTIFIC WRITING BASIC

02750217.about: MEDICAL STUDENTS WILL TAKE AN ACTIVE PART IN RESEARCH UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF A FACULTY MEMBER IN THE FACULTY OF MEDICINE. THE STUDENTS WILL DEFINE A SCIENTIFIC QUESTION! CONDUCT RESEARCH AND WRITE A SUMMARY ESSAY. ENROLLMENT IN THE COURSE IS SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF A SENIOR FACULTY MEMBER.
02750217.name: PROJECT IN FANDAMENTAL RESEARCH

02750304.about: Various aspects of the digital age. Advantages and disadvantages of digital medicine. The situation in the world, selected countries. the situation in the Israel - health services, commercial services. Electronic health records. Social aspects. Legal and ethical aspects. Doctor - patient relationship, communication, literacy. The doctor's decision - making. Economic aspects - cost . benefit, payment methods.
02750304.name: Telemedicine-Medicine in the Digital Age

02750310.about: Anatomy of the auditory tract from external ear to the auditive cortex. The nature of sound and physiology of hearing. Audiometry and tympanometry. Screening tests of early detection of hearing-impaired infants. The pathology of middle and inner ear. The sophisticated hearing tests for detection of lesion location. Congenital and acquired hearing loss. The principles of auditory evoked potentials. Vestibulogy: the physiology of the vestibular system, vastibular tests, including electronystagmography (E.N.G.). The principles of the cochlear implant. Tinnitus investigation and treatment. (Most of the subjects include demonstrations and practical work of the students.)
02750310.name: Audiology 1

02750315.about: domestic violence is common and has significant physical and mental health consequences. identification rates by health care providers are low, contributing to ongoing suffering and health care costs. participants will learn about domestic violence from the health practitioner's point of view, and acquire basic skills for approaching the issue in clinical practice.
02750315.name: Physicans and Domestic Violence

02750316.about: Physicians and health care professionals had a central role in every phase of the holocaust. The lessons of the holocaust may contribute to the education of present and future physicians in the fields of medical ethics. Roles of Nazis and Jew physicians on that time. Treatment of survivors and next generations and prevention of genocide.
02750316.name: Holocaust and Medicine

02750317.about: One of the objectives in medical education is understanding the patient, and his sickness. Literature enriches us in relation to this and other aspects such as doctor's image, doctor-patient communication, ethical issues, social and historical context of medicine. in each lesson there is a presentation and discussion of one text. The last lesson is dedicated to writing an essay on a work which is given to the students on the spot.
02750317.name: Literature and Medicine

02750320.about: 4-5 central research topics in medicine will be chosen by the course organizer. Topics will be studied according to the following criteria: principles of research design, matching different research approaches and methodologies, data analysis and drawing conclusions, examples of medical applications. Grading will be done based on a 3-page essay.
02750320.name: Introduction to Medical Research

02750321.about: Mindfulness is central to reflective practice, communication, interpersonal relationships, professionalism, and technical clinical competencies. Mindful practice can improve well being, foster resilience and reduce errors. In the course the students will practicemindfulness, narrative and appreciative enquiry while dealing with core medical professional subjects.
02750321.name: Mindfulness in Medical Practice

02750322.about: basic and surgical techniques, wound healing, sewing workshop, overview of various surgical professions (general surgery, pediatric, orthopedics, anesthesia and pain, gynecology, urology, cardiology and chest, neurosurgery, ophthalmology, plastics, ent, maxillofacial, vascular surgery, organ transplantation, research in surgical departments, summary of the surgical choice.
02750322.name: Introduction to the Surgical Professions

02750625.about: clinical elective clerkship should take place in one of the subspecialties of internal medicine.general surgery. the duration of the clerkship is one week. the clerkship will be carried out only in the departments of medical centers that are affiliated with the technion, provided that the chosen elective was not part of the mandatory clinical clerkships.
02750625.name: Faculty Elective 1

02760001.about: Physiology of sleep: sleep need, the function and characteristics of sleep. sleep stages and hyponograms, recording and quantification of sleep, the ultradian and circadian rhy hms. The effect of sleep and ciCIRCAT on physiological systems and hormones, introductio to sleep disorders, insomnia, hypersomnia, parasomnia, circadian disorders.
02760001.name: Sleep Medicine-from Physiology to Illness

02760004.about: road mapping for the entrepreneur, intellectual properties- from ideas to patents. regulatory process, animal studies- principles and models, clinical studies- from feasibility studies to crt, fund raising - angels, incubators, vcs. cardiovascular interventions- from balloon angioplasty to drug eluting stents and more, simulators, minimally invasive surgery- from bloody scenarios to computer game. medical imaging- invasive- smaller and smarter, non invasive- early diagnosis and mapping for interventions.
02760004.name: Technology Development and Entrepreneurship

02760005.about:
opportunities and challenges in healthtech from unique viewpoints of medical organizations and industry! in three innovation areas:digital medicine! pharma and medical devices. understanding digital medicine: ai! large language models! chatgpt! big data! responsible ai and real-world examples. understanding the idea-to-product process! exposure to the various physicians  role in innovation.
learning outcomes: at the end of the course the students will be able to:
 1. discuss innovation processes in the field of digital medicine/pharma/medical devices! while addressing the clinical and medical needs and their contribution to the healthcare system.
 2.  discuss ethical considerations and aspects of responsibility in innovation processes and digital medicine! with emphasis on responsible artificial intelligence (equity! reducing population disparities! proper representation of populations in models! addressing biases! etc.)._
 3. specify challenges alongside opportunities for the various parties and communities involved when discussing digital medicine technologies (e.g. the healthcare system and industry).
 4. recognize partnership opportunities between healthcare systems and th
02760005.name: HEALTH TECH INTRODUCTION

02760011.about: Physiology of the cardiovasculsr, respiratory, renal, digestive and hormonal systems, quantitative analysis of the function of the body systems. Flow in blood vessels and airways, mechanical and electrical activities of the heart, the coronary, pulmonary and systemic blood systems, regulation of the cardiovascular system, gas exchange in the lung and tissue, transport of oxygen and carbon dioxide in the blood, mechanics of breathing, control of respiration, fluid, electrolytes and hydrogen ion balance, renal secretion andregulation, absorption of nutrients in the digestive system, mobility and control of the gastrointestinal tract, hormonal control of  the internal environment, endocrine glands and principles of physiological feedback control.
02760011.name: Body Systems Physiology for Engineers

02760307.about: The physiology and physics of hyperbaric and aquatic environment. Physiological and toxic effects of hyperbaric gas mixtures. Pulmonary and neurological oxygen toxicity. Pathophysiology of diving accidents and basic principles of hyperbaric medicine.
02760307.name: Hyperbaric and Diving Physiology

02760310.about: Hormonal control of metabolism.  Diabetes melitus as a model disease for perturbation in hormonal homeostatic regulation.  Role of insulin and other hormones in the regulation level of glucose. Hormonal control of the metabolism of lipids and proteins.  Metabolism of endocrine glands.  Inherited Matabolic diseases.  Thalassemias: Sphingolipidoses.  Inherited errors in the metabolism of carbohydrates, lipoproteins and amino acids.  Roles of the liver in metabolism and diseases of the liver.  Diagnostic enzymology and plasma proteins.  Digestion.  Principles of nutrition.  Vitamins.
02760310.name: Clinical Biochemistry

02760413.about: Innate immunity and adaptive immune responses. Antibody classes and sub-classes, structure and function. Genetics and biosynthesis of immunoglobulins. Definitions of isotype allotype, idiotype. Hybridomas. Complement in humoral immunity and inflammation. Antibodybased immuno-assays. The Major histocompatibility complex genetics, function and assays. The nature of antigen. The lymphatic system organs, tissues, cells.Genetics and specificty of the T-cell receptor. The immune response cells and biological functions. Accessory cells. Cytokines and lymphokines. Inflammation and adhesion molecules. Cellular migration and cell - cell interactions. Natural an d acquired tolerance. Autoimmunity, biology of transplantation. Allergies and hypersensitivities. AIDS . Mucosal immunity. Resistance to infection. Immunity of the newborn. The molecular basis of primary immunodeficiencies. Learning outocmes: 1. Being familiar with basic immunlogical concepts and termimology. 2. Understanding processes of generation differentiation and activation of immune cells. 3. Understanding the function of the immune system, mechanisms of operation and interactions with other physiological systems. 4. Being able
02760413.name: Basic Immunology

02760419.about: What is inflammation. Mediators of inflammation:adhesion, eicosanoids, proteolytic enzymes, free radicals and cytokines. Resolutionand regulation of inflammation, repair and healing. Inflammation in chronic and infectious diseases. The systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS). TNF,NO, MMPS.TIMPS and antigen presentation as mediators in the inflammatory response.
02760419.name: Molecular Mechanisms of Inflammation

02760450.about: Principles of the endocrine system. Receptors, G. proteins, second messengers, protein kinases, genome regulation. Feedback mechanisms, densitization. Effects and regulation of production of: Hormones of the hypothalamus and the anterior and posterior pituitary, hormones of the adrenal (cortex and medulla), thyroid and pancreas, calcium- regulating hormones, prostanoids, endocrinology of maleand female reproduction. Examples of endocrine disorders.
02760450.name: Basic Endocrinology

02770210.about: Concepts of health, the definition and practice of public health, health law, the Israeli medical system, monitoring registeries, environmental health, surveillance, maternal and child health, workplace safety and health, health economy, screening and clinical epidemiology.
02770210.name: Health System in Israel

02770300.about: the course provides an overview of the evolution, embryology rganization, gender differences and the significance of injury to the centeral nervous system. patients with neurological deficits will be discussed including the surgical and non-surgical treatment of these patients. the course will speak about the history and the future of cerebral functional mapping with emphasis on brain-machineinterface. study outcomes: at the end of the course the student will be able to: 1. demonstrate knowledge of the evolution,topography and function of the human brain. 2.demonstrate a basic understanding of brain networks in eloquent areas. 3.understand the higher cerebal function such as language and emotions 4.will be familiar with the novel techniques of brain mapping.
02770300.name: Functional Neuroanatomy

02770301.about: Anatomy of the central and peripheral nervous system, relevant to transmission of sensory stimuli in general and nociceptive ones in particular. Basic theories of nociceptive stimuli transmission (e.g. the wall and melzack gate control theory of pain). Clinical and basic science pain research methodolgy based on: Psychophysics, neurophysiology, imaging and connectivity, neurotransmitters, genetics biopsychosociology. Investigation of healthy vs. Pathological cohorts. Learning Outcomes: the students 1. Will understand the intergration of Sensory and cognitive mechanisms in the nervous system as manifested in pain processing. 2. Will acquire tools for ev aluting research questions, experimental designs, data analysis and interpretations of study findings.
02770301.name: Pain Processing Mechanisms

02770311.about: The topic that will be studied are:  fast response, slow response. The ionic basis of the cardiac action potential. Sodium current and the spread of excitation. Calcium current-initiation of contraction. Outward currents. Cardiac arrhythmias - possible mechanisms.
02770311.name: Cardiac Electrophysiology

02780005.about: A seminar course which entails discussion of articles from current literature.
02780005.name: Selected Topics in Modern Immunology

02780023.about: control of gene expression: prokaryotes and eukaryotes regulation of transcription. translation and the associated quality control mechanisms. eukaryotic specific mechanisms (i.e., rna maturation and export). emphasis will be given to the recently discovered, coupling between various distinct processes of gene expression and their involvement in the appropriate response of the cell to the environemnt.
02780023.name: Regulation of Gene Expression

02780029.about: the basic and clinical aspects of the immune system. the basic section addresses the phenomena of dna recombination events, crucialdecisions during its development and the central and peripheral education pathways of lymphocytes. the clinical section will focus on the immune system in health and disease and ways in current knowledge is being used to manipulate the immune responses in cases of immunodeficiency, cancer and autoimmunity.
02780029.name: Selected Topics in Current Immunology

02780031.about: components of light microscope, kohler illumination. alignment and different contarast methods. phase, dic. fluorescent microscope:excitation and emission paths, fluorescent filters. fluorescent stereo microscope. confocal microscope: laser excitation, pinhole, detection path, optical sectioning and 3d reconstruction. different detectors: digital and ccd cameras, pmts. acquisition.anlayis softwares, signal digitization and quantization - basic applications, simple geometrical measurements.
02780031.name: Hands-on Microscopy

02780300.about: The course will give the students an opportunity to study in detail a specific topic in biophysics, to read and summarize the available material and in most cases to present a seminar.lecture.
02780300.name: Seminar in Biophysics

02780301.about: The course will give the students an opportunity to study in detail a specific topic in physiology, to read and summarize the available material and in most cases to present a seminar.lecture.
02780301.name: Seminar in Physiology

02780306.about: community perspectives and attitudes towards animal experimentation, contribution of animal-based research to knowledge and human welfare, comparative biology and behavior of common laboratory animals, biology of genetically modified animals,introductory statistics, design of animal experiments, welfare of the experimental animal,the physiology and pharmacology of pain, principles of good laboratory practice, monitoring your animal experiment, laboratory safety and animal experimentation.
02780306.name: Principles of Humane Animal Experiments

02780307.about:
neurophysiology research lab on: 
 1. methodologies (electrophysiology, imaging, microscopy, multielectrode recordings, modeling).
2. experiential models (cell culture, brain slice, whole animal behavior and physiology, etc).
 3. planning and execution of experiments designed to study adaptation, learning, motor function and sensory processing.
02780307.name: Exposure to Research of Neural Systems

02780401.about: Rate theory, occupancy theory, Scatchard analysis, alpha receptors, beta receptors, opiate receptors, Muscarinic cholinergic receptors, nicotinic cholinergic receptors, GABA receptors, benzodiazepine receptors, serotonergic receptors, receptors in platelets, characterization of receptors, receptor purification, receptor solubilization.
02780401.name: Receptors for Neurotransmitters in the Brain

02780411.about: The development of the human embryo. The embryonic period and the develoment of congenital malformations. The fetal period. The develoment of specific system: cardiovascular, the face and pharyngeal arches, the skeletal system, the eye and ear. The fubction and structure of the placenta.
02780411.name: Human Embryology

02780415.about: Selected topics in immunology from the current literature. Topics to be included are: immunochemistry, cellular immunology, pharmaco-immunology, self recognition and tolerance, genetics of the immune response, patho-immunology and developmental immunology.
02780415.name: Seminar in Immunology 1

02780416.about: Selected topics in immunology from the current literature. Topics to be included are: immunochemistry, cellular immunology, pharmaco-immunology,  self recognition and tolerance, genetics of the immune response, patho-immunology and developmental immunology.
02780416.name: Seminar in Immunology 2

02780418.about: Recent molecular studies on Gaba receptors and central and peripheral benzodiazepine receptors. The molecular basis for action of antidepressant and antipsychotic drugs. Drugs affecting intracellular calcium distribution. Prolactin and cytokine receptors and drugs affecting them.
02780418.name: Molecular Pharmacology

02780419.about: Lectures on recent research in molecular biology, immunology, cell biology, pharmacology, physiology, etc.  Each student is required to submit one paper each semester.  Attendance is compulsory.
02780419.name: Current Topics in the Medical Sciences

02780464.about: topics: diseases of skin, skeletal disorders, deafness, mental retardation, metabolic disorders, screening tests, abnormal repair of dna, the law of genetic and ethical principles, neurological diseases caused by dna repeats, microdeletion syndromes, inflammatorydiseases including fmf.
02780464.name: Seminars on Selected Subjects in Medical Genetics

02780465.about: principles of genetic counseling with regard to common abnormal findings in fetal ultrasound examination, including benefits and limitations of the procedure. abnormal fetal growth, amniotic fluid, abnormal findings of heart, kidney, brain and skeleton, twin pregnancies, maternal diseases and intra- uterine infection, invasive procedures, interventions and pregnancy termination.
02780465.name: Genetic Counseling of Abnormal Findings in Fetal Ultrasound Examination

02780466.about: practical attitude to genetic counseling, including the structure of the genetic session and ethical principles, the law of genetics, family history and drawing pedigrees, the principles of counseling for consanguineous couples, of advanced maternal age, of abnormal findings during pregnancy, of prevalent congenital disorders, risk calculations and decision making process.
02780466.name: Integrative Introduction for Practical Genetic Counseling

02780467.about: preparation of a research proposal in the field of medical genetics under the guidance of a certified medical geneticist. the written proposel will include a scientific background and relevant literature review, hypothesis and goals of the proposed research, methods and methodology, significance and practical approach to performance of the proposed research.
02780467.name: Research Project Seminar in Medical Genetics 1

02780468.about: preparation of a research proposal in the field of medical genetics under the guidance of a certified medical geneticist. the written proposal will include a scientific background and relevant literature review, hypothesis and goals of the proposed research, methods and methodology, significance, and practical approach to performance of the proposed research.
02780468.name: Research Project Seminar in Medical Genetics 2

02780469.about: basic concepts of genetic counseling including family history, recessive, dominant, x-linked, mitochondrial and multifactorial modes of inheritance, chromosomal abnormalities. oncogenetic counseling. cultural and religious characteristics of different ethnic groups. genetic screening tests. risk factors for congenital malformations and genetic diseases. understanding cytogenetic, molecular genetic, genetic analysis and biochemical testing. conveying hard . bad information to the family.
02780469.name: Practical Genetic Counseling 1

02780470.about: basic concepts of genetic counseling including family history recessive, dominant, x- linked, mitochondrial and multifactorial modes of inheritance, chromosomal abnormalities. oncogenetic counseling. cultural and religious characteristics of different ethnic groups. genetic screening tests. risk factors for congenital malformations and genetic diseases. understanding cytogenetic, molecular genetic, genetic analysis and biochemical testing. conveying hard . bad information to the family.
02780470.name: Practical Genetic Counseling 2

02780471.about: principles of flow cytometry system: liquid system, lasers, optical components, electronic components, signal identification. fluorochromes, fluorescent proteins, antibodies for flow cytometry - extracellular and intracellular staining, dna and rna dyes, cell cycle analysis, and compensation. safety ( lasers, aerosol, pathogens). the principle of cell sorting. cell acquisition and analysis: software for cell acquisition and analysis, gates, statistics, and platform for results display. facs applications in research. facs applications in the clinic. facs applications in industry.
02780471.name: Principles of Fluorescence Activated Cell Sorting Systems

02780472.about: the course will reflect our steadily expanding understanding of blood coagulation, both at the levels of the coagulation factors, and of its interactions with other systems. it will cover coagulation factors, platelets, primary hemostasis, tissue factor, natural anticoagulants, vascular biology, animal models, thrombosis, coagulation and pregnancy, cancer, and inflammation.
02780472.name: Blood Coagulation- Mechanisms and Broad Effects on Other Aspects

02780479.about: topics:  an introduction to the study of animal bhavior with attention to psychiatric disorders. the molecular mechanism, brain function and connectivity of complex behavior and behavioral phenotypic characerization. the process of developing, validating, and working animal models relevant to psychiatric disorders, and the methodology of generating knockout and transgenic mice.
02780479.name: Behavioral Models in Psychobiology Research

02780483.about: advantages and challenges in high throughput sequencing, genetics of complex traits, behavioral genetics, pharmacogenetics, epigenetics, genetics of sex determination. genetics of y chromosome, the role of rna in genetic diseases, treatment of genetic diseases, prenatal diagnosis, aging genetics and more.
02780483.name: Selected Topics in Human Genetics

02780497.about: sensory coding and cognition: vision, audition, olfaction and somatosensation. the motor system, autonomous system, the basal ganglia and the cerebellum. learning and memory. the limbic system. higher brain functions. the course will emphasize reading, self-tuition and beyond textbook contemporary research. at the end of the course the students will be able to: 1. participate in a scientific discussion in system neuroscience 2. understand the major questions in the field 3. read and discuss papers.
02780497.name: Core Course in Neuroscience

02780498.about: principles in stem cells and organ formation, early formation of specific lineages and organs during embryogenesis and controll of cell fate decisions. at the end of the course the student will know basic principles in the following topics: 1. organ formation during embryogenesis 2. pluripotent and adult stem cells. 3 organogenesis in the dish for regenerative medicine, modeling development and disease.
02780498.name: Stem Cells, Organogenesis Regeneration

02780499.about: in this course selected lectures will be given by leading scientists in the field of developmental biology from our faculty, other faculties from israel and from abroad. in addition, each student will be required to present their research project in the format of1 hour lecture. at the end of the course the student will know: 1. selected topics in cutting edge research in developmental biology 2. distinct models of different organisms that serve for research in developmental biology, the advantages and disadvantages. 3. innovative research technologies that are used in developmental biology research:labelling and tracking cells in living organism durin g development, functional screening to identify genes involved in embryogenesis etc.
02780499.name: Selected Topics in Developmental Biology

02780501.about:
basic concepts in developmental biology, early embryonic development formation of tissues and organs, stem cells,regeneration,evolution and development, developmental defects. learning outcomes:
 by the end of the course students will understand: 1. formation of the body plan in drosophila, fish, frogs, chickens, mice and humans. 2. the roles of key signaling molecules and transcription factors in development. 3. the molecular mechanisms that control morphogenesis in the  embryo. 4. the role of atem cells in tissue homestasis. 5. the phenomenon of regeneration and its molecular control.
02780501.name: Developmental Biology

02780504.about: various mathematical models in neuroscience. the course will include approximately five differents models that will vary from year to year for instance: ring model. hopfield model. model of grid cells. accumulation of evidence. context dependent integration of evidence. learning outcomes: the end of the course the student will know: 1. explain the meaning of a differential equation 2. numerically simulate ordinary differential equations. 3. analyze a dynamical system using basic analytic tools. 4. to describe the connection between a simple mathematical model and experimental results.
02780504.name: Mathematical Models in Neuroscience

02780506.about:
the course will expose students to the use of tools and methods at the forefront of research in system biology. each lecture will be given by a researcher from a different discipline. during the course the students will write a paper that analyzes both the experimental aspects and the quantitative aspects of scientific articles on one of the research problems presented during the course. the students will also present the results of their analysis in the form of a scientific seminar during the course. learning outcomes: students will:
 1. be familiar with a variety of approaches used in systems biology, with emphasis om existing methods for integrating  experimental resilts with computational models. 2. be familiar with the experimental methods for performing high- throughput experiments and the quantitative methods available for analyzing data from these experiments. 3.be familiar with the existing methods foranalyzing the dynamics of biological networks.
02780506.name: Selected Topics in System Biology

02780507.about: probability and distributions, descriptive statistics, parameteric and non-parameteric hypothesis testing. analysis of variance, regressoion. classification, dimensionality reduction, clustering. learning outcomes: at the end of the course the student: 1. will know to represent research data with appropriate quantitative and graphical tools. 2. choose and apply appropriate statistical analysis. 3. use rstudio to analyze and test data. 4. intepret statisticle results in research.
02780507.name: Biostatistics and Data Analysis

02780949.about: mechanism of replication of dna and rna viruses. the interactions of the virus with the host cell, virus-induced oncogenesis, pathogenesis of viral  infections and the response of the organism, diseases caused by human viruses, including clinical and epidemiological aspects, antiviral drugs. teaching outcomes: at the end of the students will: 1. have a basic knowledge of the biology of viruses and diseases they cause. 2. have aquired insight into the mechanism of virus replication and into the complex interactions betweenthe virus and the host cell 3. understand the high complexity of an entity virus which appears so misleadingly simple.
02780949.name: Virology

02780950.about: an introduction to electron microscopy for biological specimens. topics includes: ultrastructural studies, subcellular localizationof proteins.correlative light and electron microscopy. 3d em imaging and single particle analysis. both scanning and transmission electron microscopy will be covered by the end of the course. students will be able to : 1.understand the various techniques used in biological em analysis. 2.know how to choose em techniques appropriate for different biological specimens and questions. 3.critically read and understand biological papers that use em techniques.
02780950.name: Biological Electron Microscopy

02780952.about:
course will focus on the physiological roles of calcium ions in cells. intracellular calcium homeostasis and molecular mechanisms controlling calcium levels in cells. methods for analysis of intracellular calcium and for manipulation of intracellular calcium. generation of complex calcium signals in cells. organellar calcium signaling. the role of calcium signaling in control of cell movementand gene expression. selected topics on the roles of calcium signals in human physiology and pathophysiology. 
 learning outcomes:
pon successful completion of the course the students with be able to: 1. describe how cells dynamically modulate intracellular calci um levels.
 2. identify the key roles of cellular calcium signaling.
 3. will be familiar with current techniques for imaging and manipulation of intracellular calcium.
 4. will be familiar with the role of calcium signaling in disease states such as cancer and immunedeficiency.
02780952.name: CELLULAR CALCIUM SIGNALING

02780953.about:
this  is a seminars series course, in which, every week a different lecturer will present their science in a seminar. the students will be active during the seminar, and will stay for a discussion after the seminar. in addition, at the end of the course, the students will hand in a written assay, according to guidance questions which will be given to them beforehand. the course will teach thestudents basic understanding on scientific research, critical thinking on academic research, and in addition, will provide the students with communication skills with scientists.
 learning ouctomes:
 1. basic understanding of a sienctific research.
 2. communicati on skills with researchers, scientists.
 3. critical thinking on scientific research.
02780953.name: CURRENT TOPICS IN MEDICINE

02780956.about:
the practice of bio-medical scientists is based on philosophical principles. in this seminar, we will study different approaches toscience throughout the history of western philosophy, from the ancient greek period and into the 20th century. the seminar will be divided into 2 parts: study and implementation. first, we will study texts by aristotle, descartes, spinoza, kant, popper and kuhn. then, each student will choose a thinker with whom to compare their current work, focusing on criticism and similarities.
 learning outcomes: at the end of the course, the students will become acquainted with the philosophical principles that underly scientific inv estigation. * they will have tools with which to assess and improve existing assumptions, through an understanding of the history of philosophy of science._
 * students will acquire tools to conceptualize the challenges of their research. * students will receive tools for examining and criticizing the current state of affairs in their research field, both regarding their own research and regarding the field broadly.
02780956.name: PHILOSOPHICAL THINKING FOR SCIENTISTS

02780957.about:
as part of the course! the students will learn the common concepts in the field of ethics in medicine! changes that have occurred in the doctor-patient relationship and their ethical implications. as well as studying the philosophical basis for understanding the obligations of professionals working in a democratic society (deontological moral theory and utilitarian moral theory). in addition!they will learn the laws human dignity act! the patient's rights act! and the dying patient act. as well as the principles of ethics in medicine - human dignity! autonomy! beneficence! non malficience and justice! confidentiality and telling the truth.
 learning o utcomes: at the end of the coure the students will know to: 
 1. identify ethical behavirors. 
 2. distinguish between rules of lawand rules of ethics. 
 3. analyze an ethical issue relevant reasooning. 
 4. apply the reasonng from the moral theories learned t dilemma situations in the health care system. 
 5. apply ethical problem-solving using models. 
 6. design solutions to complex problems in the health secctor using ethical reasoning.
02780957.name: MEDICAL ETHICS AND LAW

02780958.about:
review and measurement principles for the main tools used in metabolomics research: seahorse flux analyzer, liquid and gas chromatography- mass spectrometry, nuclear magnetic resonance and , stable isotope tracing, targeted vs untargeted analysis approaches and familiarization with common data analysis tools.
 learning outcomes: at the end of the course the studetns will be:
 1. be familiar with various application of metabolomics in diverse research fields.
 2. gain the skills to thoroughly understand research papers involving metabolomics data.
